								My Journey so far in the experimental version>started out as a wanderer on brisk hill, tried to lure the the bandits nearby but failed miserably so I looted the police station>Made a Living from iron ore Mining,since looting bandits seems very unefficient and I rarely encounter them>bought a house in the city to put storage on and a research table>built an outpost near the river but it was soon overuned by river raptors so I abandoned it for a while>Journeyed to Mongrel from Brisk hill, encountered several fogmen and was captured and escaped>after escaping I was chased to mongrel Until the ninja guards killed the persuers, looted an prince hive's head and sold it>encountered Infinity wingwang ang crumblejon, using the magic of Reloading and Reset Squad position, I teleported to brisk hill to avoid encountering the fogmen againOverall this game provides a large amount of open world content, you can play it like a RPG or a RTS,.starting out is not easy since you are far more weaker than a Dog in the wild, there are glitches and crashes to encounter and the FPS is currently unstable with the current build, but as expected from an early access game it is still under development and new fixes and content are being added into the game.

								It took me a long time to decide to buy Kenshi a year ago or so. I was really intriged by this game I've never heard of before and that poping up in my steam suggestions. After reading some reviews and watching some gameplay videos I decided to risk a 20$ on this wierd looking game. Had this game for a while now. And I can say I really really like the skill system. It's a lot of fun to start with your weak♥♥♥♥♥squad and struggle to build a settlement that will survive a starving bandits raid. I had my main character becoming a martial art expert by kicking my bandit prisoners' asses on a daily basis. Said prisoners in return improved their defence skills, making it more chalenging for my character. Profit. I gave them little names.Of course the game is still in developpement and new features are still appearing and bugs are getting fixed as time passes, so I don't really mind if it's not as polished as you would expect from regular game. The gameplay is lot of fun, once you understand what the hell is going on, and the universe/lore of the game is truly unique and fascinating. I did not regret buying it.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								Kenshi hates you and will punish you for every terrible thing you’ve done in your life.It will sometimes bring its wrath down upon your unsuspecting character right out of the gate and other times it will bide its time, waiting and watching you as you build up your perfect village, before it crushes you into the sand of its hauntingly beautiful world.And that’s just one of the reasons it’s so great.At its core, Kenshi is an open world group survival simulator. You begin the game with up to five characters and your goal is to keep them alive, heck maybe even try to get them to prosper in the Japanese themed post-apocalyptic world. This is by no means easily done – your characters start out pitifully weak and even a starving bandit can (and will) beat you half to death on his way to the shop before leaving your broken mewling body lying in the sand hoping you don’t bleed to death. Which brings us nicely onto death. Losing in a fight doesn’t mean death in Kenshi, it means you’re left lying in a pool of blood. Often you’ll recover on your own and limp painfully away but even if you don’t, all you need is a single member of your group to get back to his feet and he can then run around giving medical aid to everyone. Assuming you have a medical kit. You really should have a medical kit.With your character created (from a selection of origins, ranging from easy to hard – though easy isn’t all that easy) you can choose what you want to do. Do you want to hunt down bandits, loot them and sell their gear? You can do that. Rid the world of cannibals? That too. Become a trader, ferrying goods from town to town or even start your own village to try and make your way in the world.Whichever option you choose there will be a host of enemies that want to stop you achieving your goal and they will descend upon you time and time again. Interestingly, the initial point of the game is the hardest – being poorly equipped and rubbish at everything means that anyone passing can mug you. As the game progresses you hire additional mercenaries and gain skills, perhaps a fortified town with nitro-powered crossbows all around the walls; which means that the difficulty curve is strangely reversed – the game starts hard but becomes much easier later on.Despite its roleplaying open world sandbox style, the game which Kenshi struck me as most similar to was X3 (Not X4. That was a travesty) in that you are provided with a world where you may live however you want to, and expand to become whatever you want.The graphics of the world are nice if a little sparse. The world is a barren desert and there’s little to see when travelling from one town to another. At first this sets the mood quite nicely in that it’s a barren world that’s harsh and unforgiving, but this feeling drains away after a while since there’s little change and not a lot happening. There are bandits, traders, cannibals, and all sorts of factions, but no other signs of life – I’d have liked to have seen something like mutated scorpions, giant radioactive yaks, or even an occasional cow to give the world more life. Additionally the user interface is extremely basic in looks if not function – I’d very much like to see a more graphical interface rather than the generic default grey boxes.This is Alpha though, and there is a brand new world on its way with new biomes and, hopefully, wildlife that will serve to bring the world to life.Progression is through doing. There are a host of skills related to survival and combat and each skill is improved by doing work in that skill – the Engineer skill, for instance, is improved by building things. There are also three stats; strength, toughness, and agility, and these too are improved by doing things related to the stat – Toughness is increased by getting your face kicked in.Sound is still somewhat lacking; there is a pleasant music track throughout but ambient sounds – the hum of generators or creaking of windmills – is noticeably missing.I definitely recomend this game but, if you do get it, prepare to spend some time looking at your character whimpering and  gushing vital fluids.

content:
Posted: January 4
Early Access Review
								Worth the money I found. Ive got most of the game figured out other then the exploring part. I stuck to mostly town building. After that I made an army of people and made my way north to get a better feel for the fighting part. I found it usefull if you build resting outposts were ever you wanna send troops. All in all though I have to explore the combat and the world map more. For now though im taking a break so I can come back to the game later with a bunch more updates. Even if it wasant updated anymore I would be fine with whats is working and done so far. Really easy squad management. A little buggy for plotting movments on world map but eventually you figure out that there is certain points that work. If  you try to really far spot on the map you squads might not make it. As for graphics I actually really like it. I always enjoy all the detail off how diffrent some of the areas look. Its nice that its not some generated map for once. Worth the price! Its a game that I know I will always play.

content:
Posted: March 7
Early Access Review
								1.9 hours in(at the time of this review), I think its safe to say this game is worth it. After reading through the planned features on the main website, its clear the devs have  the potential to make this game a success.Its true, the start is hard. Especially if you're playing on rock bottom like me. But in time, each hour you survive, you get stronger and faster. While not being too powerful, this game teaches you how to be smart and humble. Don't be fooled by that herd of goats wandering aimlessly. To give you a visual of what its like in Kenshi, here's my first playthrough.>naked dude walking around>see group of people in the distance>'hello friends!'>nope, slavers.>'don't think about running!' 'C'mere meat!'>at first it was just one guy>whole squad joins in>1 blow to the head>KO>unconcious for 400 seconds>wake up>hungry, broken arm, bleeding head>reach lone shack>broke>see iron resource>its mining time!>8 ingame hours later>fed and recovering>mine some more>get iron stick>stats increase while mining(str and labour)>see goats>prepare to get sacrficed to okran! >whole herd attacks me>dying>in lone shack>some guy picks me up>im saved!>lolnope.gif>throws me outside>die outside of lone shack>endThats how exciting my life was in Kenshi. All in all, worth it.

Posted: February 6
Early Access Review
								One word comes to mind to describe Kenshi: CONTENT.There is LOTS of CONTENT. This game is like Skyrim mixed with Total War mixed with Fallout mixed with Rust mixed with Divinity:Original Sin. With the totality of CONTENT from that mixture.No multiplayer - atrocious performance - crashes galore - blatantly unfinished downright pre-alpha "tech demo" feel - ugly visuals - buggy as all hell - frustratingly unforgiving and difficultAnd yet I keep playing. If you are an intelligent, patient, PC-tech-literate, determined gamer, you will find a real gem here. You just gotta dig REAAAAL deep.Did I mention you need patience? Lots of patience.VERDICT: Buy the F*** out of this game right now. Stop reading reviews and just buy it - you MUST experience the enigmatic contradiction that is Kenshi

content:
Posted: January 1
Early Access Review
								FIrst off, I have had this game for a good many years now; It has progressed so greatly that I feel proud when I play it now. Proud for the developers and proud of how I have learned the ins and outs of this game. This game started out pretty basic, just lots of sand dunes and hungry bandits everywhere. Slowly, a game started to appear out of the haze. Building towns, getting invaded, shop counters (still kind of broken, oh well) and then cannibals. Gotta love cannibals! Now the map expands and there are new places to uncover. I recently uprooted from one area into Holy nation land (Although they hate me) once I had a devoted military group. I have a base in on an island sorrounded by rivers and the holy nation must cross the water to get to me... Which is no easy feat while getting hit by mounted crossbows =)This game will kick your♥♥♥♥♥hard though. I started out in a setting that gives you a veteran soldier who is hated by the biggest faction in the game currently. It gave me a springbox to move forward though. I worked up his stealth and was able to kidnap a holy nation soldier in camp and use his armor as a disguise to get into their cities. Oh there are also raptors and giant turtles to kill and eat11/10

content:
Posted: April 16, 2014
Early Access Review
								This, at the moment an early access indie game, is an RPG game with elements of RTS. You can play this game as one character, or play it as a group (at the moment maximally 20 peoples).None of your characters will be "unbeatable". Even your main character is just a man - and in the beginnings practically everyone will be better.Usually I start the game in hardest mode. Totally naked, with bad arm and a STICK. Yes - I can survive somehow... The best way how to show that any character can die is to give a preview of my game:I got around six peoples group and went from city to city. I walked too close to Cannibal outpost, and all my group except one girl had been prisoned. I walk then with that girl, and found a band of samurai's. And I made her to walk with them... Then I ordered all the rest of the band, to try pick-lock their cage to get out. one by one I managed to get out... One of the cannibals started to attack to my first character - to the AssassinLV, they beated him up... And were eating my character... After time He managed to get out... But My band was beated up - again but still alive... Later I was close to the city - when bandits attacked on my band... After many attacks AssassinLV were dying... Then that girl - who was not kidnapped, I ordered her to save my character, cause he had the bag full of trade... She managed to prevent AssassinLV from dying, but also she was noticed by other group of bandits... Then she was dying... And no one could been able to save her... She died - cause she was saving the other......

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 4, 2014
Early Access Review
								Do you like The SIms, or squad based RPGs in general (games where you can control multiple characters or individual ones each with their own skills, and statistics)Do you like Ninjas? Have you ever wanted to play a sims type game in a ninja / samurai filled apocalyptic world?this is the game for you, its a bit rough around the edges still, and sometimes the glitches can be quite frustrating But with the bad out of the way this game is a master class game that you should try. Favorite parts: The game plays without you and your characters are not "heroes" they are probably weaker than almost anyone you can encounter.. however they have the ability to grow depending on what you do. The game will not need you to start events, or to stop them. You are more of a drop of water in a big puddle. You can influence and affect what happens.. if a big band of bandits shows up at a city your base is near, they can take out the guards and shops, effectively neutralizing the town. Later a travelling group of lawmen might take it back.. either way, even if you could have changed the outcome, the game keeps playing. Your characters have stats in almost everything. if you want yout character to be stronger, give him or her a lot of heavy equipment and have them run around. Eventually their strength will increase. Speed is the opposite, have someone run around without anything in their bags and they will become more athletic and therefore faster. Laboring from mining, or smelting. Crafting from weapon or armor smithing. Medicine from healing. The characters become increasingly valuable as time goes on..The fact that you  can plop a town wherever you want, build walls, turrets, arm your soldiers with swords and armor and have your builders be guarded and automated with designated tasks is beautiful. Kenshi is absorbing, Rough, Frustrating, Comically suprising and has the potential to be an amazing game. Id say get it.. try it, support the devs and enjoy the process of their creation

number of helpful: 7 of 14 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 18, 2016
Early Access Review
								Started with a few people, made a bunch of wheat farms, and established a bread factory. After fending off tons of overly hostile beaked giraffes and endless patrols of king kong, finally got some walls and made a pretty respectable town. Every once and a while, characters would get stuck and glitch on many items (terrain, buildings, enemies)... all solved by picking up the char with another char and putting them back down (some kind of reset)All glitches aside, things were going great. Never mind the random spawning of ♥♥♥♥♥ons of cannibals and hostile wildlife that made my characters constantly stop and battle (inside town walls). I ended up making 500k running my bread factory and selling excess armor/weapons from the smithy. SO I decided I would set out with my fairly rugged, well laboured, farmers and see what hell I could raise. I walked not even 200ft to see a char get stuck. WELL I try my normal technique of using another char to pick up char... etc. Hrm WHAT IS THIS!?Somehow, I managed to get no one unstuck and my entire squad stuck instead. Then my autosave kicks in...As I'm trying to problem solve...My previous hard save was from over 4 hours ago. I feel like I just lost time in my life I will never get back. Overall, very fun addicting concept, but with multiple years in, you'd think they would have character pathing and tracking down.

content:
Posted: October 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								EARLY ACCESS REVIEWThis game has been in my library now for awhile and I'm cleaning up my reviews, here's how I feel after owning this game for over a year:The concept, the depth and the artwork are golden but why negative? They overhauled this game to what it seems to come back to the same conclusion, it's unplayable. The bugs, performance issues will slowly if not instantly ruin your game (mind you that this game is a grind, bugs and show stoppers will wash away hours of work). They have been adding to this game which is great but they still have yet to deliver something that's playable. Most of the previous positive reviews were more than likely from the previous build which was more playable to an extent***The game itself will be a masterpiece if its ever finished but thats where I give it a negative review, it felt almost complete before the overhaul now it feels like its taken a few steps back but with even more depth and with the scale I'm wondering if it will every be completed. I'd grab it on sale or hold off, its one of those games that wow you, you play, the bugs and un-optmized feel have you back shelf the game to only revisit. Devs are active but are quick to ban... recommend not bringing up bugs or scorn against this game or commenting on the active state of the game.Below is a response from a Dev/Moderator that I wasn't too fond of, if you have a questions and it can be generically answered by a moderator like below, you may see this again. Originally posted by Captain Deathbeard:This is what game development is like: -You've got a list of 100 features and 100 bugs.-Every time you add a feature, it adds another 50 bugs.-Every time you fix 10 bugs, you discover 3 more bugs.-Occasionally to fix one of the bugs you might need to totally restructure something. This will probably add 10 more bugs.-When you fix bugs people say "These updates don't do anything, where are the features?"-When you add features people say "Why aren't you fixing the bugs?"

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								Decided to come back and update my review for this one.The basic concept of a squad combat is solid and meshes well with the RPG style caracter progression.Combat itself is both simple and complex at the same time, and there is no real right or wrong way to equip your caracters. Though some builds do require alot of certain stats to really shine.That being said some balancing may be nessisary (and is probably allready planned) in the future. Going alongside the caracter managment is as of so far fairly basic faction system. What is there mostly works and there is alot of room for improvement. What is there though is enough to know for certain that if you steal and murder everything in one town you wont be totally screwed out of profiting off your illicit deeds.Speaking of illicit deeds there is also a system for stealth, and thivery. Again its not fully implemented but what is planned is enough to make both Garret and Etzio foam at the mouth. From simple B&E burglary to disguises, and even assasinations planned further in the pipe. Speaking as a player with over 500 hours in the game, the ability to one hit kill anyone and anything in the game with assasination is a very powerfull gamechanger.The game also features an economy with growing diversity. Better yet, unlike most other games that feature combat and trading a full blown trader focus is a viable option to transition from rags to ritches. Especially if you take the time to venture out and build your own Outpost/Town/Fort and produce your own trade goods/weapons.Not everything is sunshine and rainbows obviously. It is currently an alpha (soon to be beta) and there are optimization issues with DX11. DX9 runs alot smoother and dosent look all that different in my opinion though. The game does crash from time to time (especially again if your running with DX11) Alot of newer players seem to have problems with the difficulty mof the game but personally I cant fathom why.All in all though its a very fun game as it is now with a lot of new features and content planned in the future, so as long as you can tolerate the flaws that are pretty common with anything youl find in Early access developement.

content:
Posted: February 17, 2016
Early Access Review
								New update. Time to change the review right?! It looks better, the camera follows your team. The world looks less like sand in your eyes and more like a setting. Sweet right. Nope. Still the same stupid thing happens everytime I start a game. I have a bunch of useless units who can't fight. I bump into a mob of trained killers, 30 units strong. How hard is it to set mob spawns to a game timer. Time < 40 minutes, Mob = 5. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. IT DOESN'T WORK. IT JUST KILLS YOU OVER AND OVER AGAIN. It's not like dark souls. It's not fun, or rewarding. Your units don't get stronger. They get robbed, the get kidnapped, they get killed. There is no way to progress your units. Again. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. Level 0 villager ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t is still real. There is still no way to prevent this. You can now pick from a bunch of races, even one with a warrior caste. Guess what. They get cut down like trash bags in the wind by 30 bandits with sticks just like your humans. While your breast size has a slider, there is still no slider for fighting skills. Long time player same stupid flustrations.I like the concept of this game. I can take a group of people into a hostile desert and make a civilization. What I don't like is watching dogs eat it. I don't like random groups of 30 guys with sticks knocking everyone out and walking off with them. I'm not sure what the developers play for games, maybe the sims? The group of starting colonists the game gives you all start out as level 0 village meat shields with one slightly less useless guard. Mobs are huge. The game suggests that you train all your little people in a town first, by attacking the dummies. This is a 15 minute process. Why not let me mod stats? Why not set those stats higher and skip wasting my life? Time invested versus reward is terrible. Whatever my graphic setting are at I can never see the enemy mobs coming. So suddenly 30 guys are beating my villagers to death. If they go down they need a med kit to get back up. Which you get very few of, and cost more than an arm and a leg. I wouldn't reccomend this. The play testers must all be used to doing all these stupid chores just to play or have some cheat codes. That or starting a colony got lost in the developer shuffle.

number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								Early access experimentalPros- the game has tons of potential.  Where it's heading looks to be a fully sandbox solo play any way you want mode.       - lots of progress has been made and continues to be made at a slow pace but with huge updates.       - be a wanderer, be a trader, be a builder, you decide or be all of them at once when you have 30 characters in your faction.        - it looks decent, and gets better with most updates.  Cons- Failure is the norm.  You can get wiped out in under 2 minutes of starting and have to restart.  You can also get wiped out after dozens of hours.  It can get frustrating for most players.        - Learning curve is extremely steep with nothing in-game to point you in the right direction or even give you goals.        - Character progression in skills is hellishly slow.  You can play upwards of 20 hours and not see much stat increases higher than level 15, which is incredibly low.        - Gets boring when all you do is dig ore, make weapons to sell to npcs, repeat repeat repeat repeat.....nothing much else to do at this stage.        - You can't seem to progress combat characters skills enough to survive enemy encounters.  Most bandits will outnumber and easily wipe out all your characters so you need to have one or two hiding far enough away that they can revive the rest of your party when it is beaten.  Even so, combat skills only go up with use and using them is decidely not in your favor.  Perhaps this is going to be addressed at some point, but for now, be a coward and run away.        - Looting used to be the way to make money early in the game....now it gets you killed even if you loot bandits, because you're a lousy stinking thief! and the guards will come kill you when you try to sell that stolen junk from a dust bandit that would have gotten you 7 coins before....        - Been in alpha for several years already and looks to be at least another couple more before beta.  It's a small team, and therein lies the problem.  They sell the game, but don't invest the money back into it to get a larger team to work on the game.  The result, a very long development time.WHEN the game gets further developed, storylines and reasons to play will be added in.  As it is right now, it's something to keep an eye on and pick it up on a sale.  There's just not enough content to bother with and what is in game isn't balanced out.  Perhaps in a couple more years it will be at the point where it might be enjoyable enough.

content:

Early Access Review
								Well, its nearly everything I could have wanted in a game. The RPG elements, the gradual skill increases as you perform various actions, the "exploration," hell, even being a character that has a backstory that suits your playstyle. The game is great with a bit of a rocky start, but after you recruit a good amount of people (at least 6-7), you can finally get things rolling with the crafting and settling of your own town- that is, if you don't choose to live in a pre-made town. The possibilities are truly endless, and no playthrough will be the same- unless you play narrow-mindedly and safe. While I am mildly unsure as to what changes have been made to the world, the playability even through its alpha stage is marginally better than when I first bought the game. I, in fact, created my own world and recently finished it in liue of Dark Souls. The modability is there and given to you on a silver platter. All it takes is a bit of understanding, some programs, and the already there construction set and you're good to go.Overall, I'd give Kenshi an 8/10.Die well.

content:
Posted: July 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								Kenshi is an open world squad based RPG -- it feels like those "choose your story" books.  I play many different genres in games, but I've really struggled to find some sort of city builder that gives you freeroam over your city, free choice on how to build, lots of customization, and a city defense aspect.  I've also struggled to find a good squad based game.  The good squad based games I do find, like Company of Heroes 2, are not open world.  I feel like this is the game I've been searching for, as cheesy as it sounds.This game has been in development for 4 years now, ouch! - but just because it is considered an early access game doesn't mean it isn't polished.  What you'll find while playing this is fantastic gameplay (better than a lot of AAA games), fantastic soundtracks, fantastic building, fantastic customization, fantastic environment, great AI, confusing UI, and a medium amount of bugs.  It's really cool that the devs also created a modding kit for the game. This game is a gem that not many people know about.  To give you and idea on what it is, watch these:  


YouTube™ Video: Let's Play Kenshi Part 1: Sick with Sticks 

			Views: 903		

			Gettin' some of that sweet Samurai-Desert-Apocalypse Action! Please Comment, Like, and Subscribe! Follow me on Twitter, why not! http://www.twitter.com/KillerPandaLP		

 -- Starting out


YouTube™ Video: Let's Play: Kenshi - S2 Ep. 27 -  City Under Siege! 

			Views: 3,049		

			Kenshi is a open-ended sandbox squad based RPG. The world is yours to create, destroy, or protect. With several different factions you can interact with, you have plenty to do.		

 -- Mid Game


YouTube™ Video: Kenshi - Indie Spotlight - Part 37 - I. Am. Warrior. 1 vs 100 

			Views: 3,545		

			Exploring all aspects of Kenshi including combat, trading, building, and everything else. Kenshi is a single player free-roaming Role Playing Game, with a Real-Time Strategy influence.		

 -- The Power of Moddinghttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L1eIujt8lBw -- Combat and AtmosphereI do want to address some negative reviews to enlighten people on the negative parts of the game, and some flat out lies.  The fact that this game has been in development for 4 years is not a good thing.  Although the studio has less than 10 people working on the game.  I remember about 3 or so years ago they wanted people to email them atmospheric music for the game with royalties.  It does feel like a good game in the end, but it isn't quite there yet to be considered the game they promised.This game has trivial updates.  This is true in some aspects, but not completely.  The amount of updates put out is a large number and each update adds something that they have promised.  Compared to some other small studios, the amount of updates isn't impressive.This game is not immersive.  Pffffft.  I bet you would say that The Walking Dead (game) isn't immersive too.  Some reviews are blatant lies.Crashes and bugs out 70% of the time.  In the 20 hours I have played, I havent crashed at all or witnessed any game breaking bugs.  If you do decide to use some experimental tools, like the freebuilding (different than the standard building) mode, you're going to get bugs.  I tried out the freebuilding mode, which lets you place buildings without any cost, and my squad decided to turn on each other.  There is no reason not to play on a faster timescale, it's like watching simulator 2015.  What would you expect in a city builder?  Have you played Banished, Cities Skylines, or Dawn of Discovery?  Actually, have you ever played a city builder?  The game is about progression, not having everything handed to you in the first hour.  Whoever said this also doesn't understand there are other aspects to the game than just building.  I hope this helped anyone wanting to buy the game.Thanks for reading!

Early Access Review
								Hello people, this will be a straight up review no ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t or anything like that, so here goes.I personally like the game, it has everything that I personally want. It's time conusming, if you want a challenge here it is, it will take you time to play and become good so you have to be willing to put it in. Great features and there are more features put into the game nearly every update. The difficulty, believe it or not, is fair but they implimented new features to make it harder or easier if you want more/less of a challenge. Your crew members will eventually die one way or another so you really do need to strategise and make sure you, yourself are 110 % convinced they will live, but that's not always the case. It used to be no sound, 1 squad max of 9 or 10, and only a certain amount you could achieve. Now, however, it is bustling with more squads, more research, tech, buildings, even mounted crossbows on walls to great giant walls. Now like I said it will take you time to achieve the perfect citadel or city but it really is worth the effort. Back bout 2 years ago I wouldn't recommend this game because it just didn't have enough in it to call it, in my opinion, alpha version. But now I really think that this version, the alpha at the moment is worth gettiing. There is a very long play time and at the moment near endless possibilities in the game, whether just making a base, or setting impossible goals, you can achieve it. However there are downfalls, (1st) the dev team is still relatively small making big updates slower to come out (however they are covering everything when an update does coe out), (2nd) there are very much so, alot of glitches and the AI path system is alittle stupid and annoying sometimes and the game itself can sometimes crash unexpectedly (3rd) some of the features aren't out yet which really really bugs me because they sound really cool, so there has to be a wait.Other than that, it really is a brilliant version at the moment and I can't wait for the final release!Happy Gaming and I hope this review was helpful and pointed you to a good purchase!

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								For every frustrating buggy moment I have (understandably as it's alpha) I have 100 great ones. Hyperbole maybe but my purpose is to illustrate the difference between the amazing immersion of those great unscripted moments this game supplies you with so often VS. the insignificance of the frustrating ones that occur quite rarely.  It is currently an imperfect game that is full of perfect moments. The music is right, the vibe is absolutely right, the stripped down no guidance on how to accomplish anything, while perhaps not intended for future builds, feels totally right.  You are dropped in a desolate landscape with bands of wandering thugs and brigands and tasked with figuring out how to survive. Crazy loner in a hut? Start a town with tons of followers? Just wander the waste and scavenge corpses then sell junk to NPCs? Build an armor and weapon crafting factory? Produce and sell weed and rum? All possible and you'll probably do a bit or tons of each.The skill system is great as far as im concerned. The more you do something the better you get at said skill. Makes sense. Want to be tougher? Get beat to hell often (and recover hopefully). Want to be quicker? Run around with low encumberance. Stronger? Swing a heavy sword and wear heavy armor. Same system goes for crafting obviously.There is zero pre generated story to be had here. If you need Bioware levels of explanation for why you're playing your game then stay away. It's 110% no direction sandbox. If you have a creative mind and sense of adventure and find creating your own backstory and narrative enjoyable then buy it. It's that simple.Death will happen but it always feels like my fault when it does. Overconfidince or negligence is usually to blame. That being said, SAVE OFTEN. No "respawns" here. You reload the last save.Perfect blend of Samurai disciplines and the chaos of Mad Max (sans vehicles). Slow development and occasionally glitchy but I could not care less. I really hope the tiny dev team (couple people I think?) sticks with it. One of my favorite games in recent years.

content:

Early Access Review
								It's been about a year or so and I figure I should edit this review. The game is extremely challenging. You are NOT meant to be the chosen one, nor the best of a rag-tag bunch of guys. You are a person. You will get your♥♥♥♥♥kicked. A lot. That said, your character learns from each mistake. So long as they don't die. Enemies don't really go for the kill (well... cannibals are a different story). Eventually, you and your squad might take on the world. That's the fun part. Watching them grow.Want a hard game? Unforgiving? Kenshi is the squad RPG/RTS for you.

content:
Posted: December 14, 2014
Early Access Review
								Overall I was suprised I enjoyed this game. Even though it is early access and a lot to be done, even though I still got addicted. I love games that allow you choose your own path and essentially start from the bottom and rise to the top. This game will become amazing once they add more features and implement a few things here and there. So if you are willing to look past bugs and limited features at the moment then this game is a lot of fun and will get you pumped to see how they make the game grow.If you like challenging/unforgiving games (similar to Blade & Mount) then this is the game for you. Here I was lone wanderer who got attacked by a very large pack of dogs. Luckily next to a city so once I was unconcious in like 2.5 secs the guards dispatched them like chump change. I layed there (after the guards healed me) for 2 days in a recovery coma. While I figured I could reload the game I was like "eh what the heck" and waited it out. This game will be challenging in the beginning. You definitely don't start out like a power house.Graphic wise its okay. Nothing great nor terrible.Character leveling, skills, building, and the like are fun but limited at this point in time. I can only imagine as the game gets better and adds more how it will be. You can even customize your companions once they are recruited. Fighting is a lot like MMO's minus all the special abilities. Its point and they fight kind of thing.As of now there are no quests but I am sure through time some will be added. As of now its just roam, get money, build, and get companions.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 12, 2014
Early Access Review
								The best way to describe the Kenshi game world would be to think tattoine crossed with asian culture. Kenshi is a totally unique genre of game, it's a mix of RTS, RPG and Simulation but has the ability to make you feel invested in your own characters due to the random nature of the world. It's still got a while to go before the finish line but with additional content, alot of bug fixes + optimisations and more of the same passion and attention to detail that the Dev has shown so far, i have no doubt that Kenshi could wind up being one of the greatest games ever made. It's a labour of love and it truly shows. In it's current state Kenshi already has enough content to make the purchase worth the money so i whole heartedly recommend picking this game up if you want to support a Dev who's creative direction is a breath of fresh air.Some suggestions for the Dev in the event he reads this :- Add the ability for the camera to aim upwards not just eye level (It would be nice to be able to see up hills and see more of the stars).- Add Bo Staffs to the Blunt weapon list when you add it in.- The Martial arts skills in the future should be about disarming and disabling your opponents.- Animals that act as pack mules for the travelling merchant playstyle would be great.- Shields would be a nice addition. Much lower damage output but much higher survivability against groups swarming you.-  Bows not just crossbows. Ranged weapons should do low damage but be more likely to cripple limbs and cause bloodloss.- Even more weapons, armor for crafting/purchasing ect.Anyway keep up all the great work and best of luck for the future of Kenshi!

content:
Posted: June 18, 2015
Early Access Review
 *** THIS GAME IS NOT FOR EVERYBODY, ESPECIALLY IN ITS CURRENT STATE *** The early access boilerplate aside, if you're used to early access, this is one of steam's current gems. It is probably one of my favorite sandbox games, and my overall favorite city builder. What you get is worth your money, as long as you're willing to trudge through a few issues.Cons - * Not very optimized (early access)* Rather buggy (many temporary fixes, usually nothing major)* Occasional crashing (just remember to save)* Some balance issues (harpoon turrets as a prime example)* Certain starting paths don't feel full enough* Slow updates (this is what will likely make or break for most people)Pros - * Very open ended sandbox* Innovative health and damage system* Pick, choose, and change paths* Great city builder* Craft virtually anything* Plethora of different skills to train* Still living early access game after many years in development* (Usually) speedy bug fixing* Very involved character creation* Put your enemies (or friends, I don't judge) into jail cells* Many, many more things not mentioned here.If you enjoy sandbox, can deal with bugs and occasional crashing, don't mind being patient for updates, didn't plan on using the $20 for your next meal, and are willing to take a risk on early access, this is one of the best purchases you can make. Like I said, it isn't for everybody -- with this game, patience is key.If it sounds like something you'd like and can tolerate, I can't recommend this enough.

								The controls are a bit busting in the knee, but this game reminds me a lot of Runscapes GAMEPLAY (Not story line), So i'm getting used to the controls rather quickly. However, It runs very slow on mine. No worries though. :) Still needs some tweaks though to make it better. :) I wish you could have the option to move your character (Ex. WSAD) AND or Click your character to move. So it's even, and fair. Maybe a storyline at the beginning of the game? To spark things up a bit? Good, good game. I applaud you for this works.(HAVE ONLY PLAYED FOR ABOUT 10 MIN. XD TELL ME IF THIS IS ALREADY IN THE GAME PLEASE. )If you really wanted to spark people's attention, You should add MASSIVE Immersion RPG into the game. Such as, Stealing from an NPC, NPC Talk to Talk words. Meaning, You could choose over more than one or two answers for every single conversation, almost like in a Visual Novel.NEW UPDATE***Alright, I am at a complete loss. However, I have gotten used to the controls 100%. I am confused because if i leave the town and run towards the nearest town, I get attacked, and murdered in seconds. I am a trader. I sold all my stuff, to get good clothing.. Can someone tell me where the weaponry is in there? I might just have to spend it on finding 5 guys with a Katana. I can hardly make it through. By God the deaths. 60000 hrs later your guySSSS come back alive. Well, I suppose I could go towards another town... But, eh. Maybe if it's my last resort. Am I doing something wrong? Are there any jobs at the beginning of the game that you can do? I went to the police station for a bounty quest thing, and the only thing he said was for me to go kill a leader or a bandit for something. I can't even fight 1. My character won't fight until after it (Yes, i know how to turn it off) , but once he gets hit, it's like he can't hit others. Umm... Not judging, but when can I do research so i can earn better stuff? What do i need to do (As a merchant) before I go and fight the bandits on the nearest town? Lastly, are there any questions in the newb town that I will MOST LIKELY be able to do? Yes, I realized the game is a little bit different for everyone, but please help!~Thanks.P.s Review and Conversation? xDP.s.s Very good game so far for a Beta!

content:
Posted: March 12
Early Access Review
								An amazing game of epic proportions.This game is not without flaws, first of all. If you have a slow computer or laptop you should expect frequent freeze-ups and even crashing. If you have a decent driver and a decent computer then you should be fine.Onto the good things, this game is incredibly difficult, you'll die or lose several times before you develop a gameplan to make it. Not to mention when you step into this game you'll be surprised to find yourself in an alien land both familiar and mysterious, you'll probably explore far enough to realize the inevitable nature of oneself. You are mortal, you are weak, and you are nothing compared to the beasts and residents of this land. You can be captured, imprisoned, enslaved, and you can break away from slavery and wander until you find a method of removing the binds.There is a silver lining though, being taken down isn't always the end, many roaming guards and factions will patch you up if they see you, other times your wounds may heal themselves and the more you get beat, the tougher you get. So being a legendary ninja or samurai is still possible.

								This game is just so absolutely amazing. Its quite an open sandbox, and has plenty of gameplay, presently, but is also heavily in development. 								A Pro review-no cons I bought this game a good couple months back, i held my breath as time went on and these guys have been really consistant with thier updates ! they are pretty responsive in terms of development and theres a particular moderater hanging around here in steam and on thier website forum who's been dedicating thier time to Q & A. I run a 32 bit system and was worried people who runs like me have been forgotten but recently they released an update for the 32 ! huzar now i can eat my piece of the cake :D, first time i jumped in i play as a retired captain went out immediately to fight some bandits there are some major noticeable changes since i last played last year and its now become more Hard, funny and enjoyable. now after encountering bandits i bit off more than i could chew i battled with a boss bandit and defeated him but his lackeys popped round to save him, i ran back to town (micro managing the chase, quite the engaging affair if i do say so myself) but i made one wrong move and got knocked out...which then the bandits proceeded to steal my clothes the odd but funny part is that aside from the fact he took my medkit he also took my pants XD ! End conclusion these guys are consistant with most things and the game at times can be engaging almost getting the balance between rpg/rts ! i have high hopes and looking forward to the changes being made including the new races !

Early Access Review
								I have played this game for 58 hours as of the writing of this review.  The game is a work in progress, but a pretty good one.  I will say that the developer, Chris Hunt (a.k.a. Captain Deathbeard) has been constantly improving this game over the past couple of years.  Do you like Post-apocolyptic, Ninja, crafting, RTS, RPG, sandbox games or never tried any of those?  You will like this game.  It's wierd, but wierd can be pretty fun.  A few bugs, but the team is cleansing the game of them with each update.  Generally speaking, this game is just plain fun.  And that's really why we play games, right?

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 16, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is a hard one. The game is amazing, it's alot of fun and has heaps of content already. The biggest problem this game has however is it's bugs. The bugs are literally everywhere, one example: i enter the game i get into character creation and i crash because my graphics settings were too high, which brings me to another problem, this game has no optimization for any graphics card, my gtx 780 ti runs overlcoked at 1150mhz in this game for some reason it only reaches 650mhz, as if the game is trying to limit my gpus potential, neverthless i still get decent framerates, which leades me to another problem, the random lag spikes which drop frame rates to 5, which leads me to tell you that you will be playing for an hour, then bug solving for the next. At least this is my current situation. I just spent 3 hours trying to get my characters to another town, because all the merchants in the town i was in bugged out and the trade screen would not show up. That's 3 hours of constant re-loads etc due to bandit attaacks killing everyone in my squad, due to lag spikes, and no matter how many reloads the merchants did not sell me anything. I now have to restart the entire game. Do not buy this bugfest until i can go from City A to City B without restarting my game at least 3 or 4 times. But those few hours of gaming that you manage to sneak in as the bugs gather reinforcements are truly magnificent, and because i want more money going to these devs, meaning more bug fixes i am reccommending this game. There are people complaining that the devs are focusing too much on bug fixes, they need to spend the next year fixing bugs in my opinion, the content here is good enough as it is, i merely want to enjoy the content not look at new bug-filled content if you know what i mean.Take this review as u will, a 10/10 game, but has more bugs than the amazon.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 22, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is my first review for a game so I'll try to keep it brief, lol I've put many hours into this game, and do enjoy it, though currently there is no story line, none of your actions in any way influence the world around you except when maybe the reputation system is working, which is definitely hit and miss. The pathing system still has bugs, and often times you will find people with assigned jobs stuck against something, or trying to interact with an object inside a building from the outside. I have had the game for well over a year and while updates do come out more often now (usually once every month or every two months), they still have yet to resolve really important game play issues.I do however encourage you to purchase the game, as a fun way to pass the time inbetween games with actual story content and substance (this game currently lacks any), as the base building is fun and watching your people mow down starving bandits with turrets, who just want to attack and not steal your food, which totally refutes their name of "starving bandits".To sum it all up, they have some really lofty goals for the game, and if they come through with them, it will be an amazing purchase. If not you will at least have a base building game where you randomly get zerged by bandit/creature patrol, so if you are into being punished with no reward, it is definitely for you.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								There is something endearing about this game. I purchased this game far before it was on Steam and have loved watching its continued growth. It is truly one of the handful of games I am interested in and has a charm that I find hard to describe. I suppose I am attracted to the game because the developer made it so you are not a special snowflake in this game, you are a normal person or group of people with no special powers or abilities with the only difference from your characters and the games NPCs being your drive for success in whatever path you chose.Any skills have to be earned and only through trial and error. You will be beaten down, your goods and clothing stolen, you will limp back with broken bones to whatever you consider safety, and then try again only to fail. With each failure you gain experiance though and eventually you will be able to eke out a living on scraps and eventually maybe even make an outpost that could blossum into a metropolis you run, another city on the ever growing map with a whole new diplomatic game to consider. Or just be a lone wanderer trying to survive, making your own story among the sand dunes.Possibly a true sandbox game when it eventually finishes... + Developer is not only active but also has an interesting personality/beard.+ Constant updates+ Fresh kind of gameplay+ Future plans look bright and, more importantly, actually going to happen.- Very Glitchy, many crashes, texture issues, shadow problems, characters getting stuck, etc (Alpha problems)- Slow to add new content but understandable as they are focusing on getting the game more stable. - General "Alpha"ness that will go away with timeI highly recommend this game even on its current merits. The future for this game looks to be an amazing one and I can not wait to see how well it comes together.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 12
Early Access Review
								An amazing game of epic proportions.This game is not without flaws, first of all. If you have a slow computer or laptop you should expect frequent freeze-ups and even crashing. If you have a decent driver and a decent computer then you should be fine.Onto the good things, this game is incredibly difficult, you'll die or lose several times before you develop a gameplan to make it. Not to mention when you step into this game you'll be surprised to find yourself in an alien land both familiar and mysterious, you'll probably explore far enough to realize the inevitable nature of oneself. You are mortal, you are weak, and you are nothing compared to the beasts and residents of this land. You can be captured, imprisoned, enslaved, and you can break away from slavery and wander until you find a method of removing the binds.There is a silver lining though, being taken down isn't always the end, many roaming guards and factions will patch you up if they see you, other times your wounds may heal themselves and the more you get beat, the tougher you get. So being a legendary ninja or samurai is still possible.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								This Game has a fascinating concept, its playable actually and you can probably extract a lot of "Fun" out of this, The only issue I have with this game has to do with 2 things, one would be the constant delays and excuses to release an upcoming patch, now I get it, coming out with updates can be pretty hard, lots of coding involved and the fact that the game is in Ogre3D makes it even worse, the other issue is the time that this game has been in development, now i'm extremely patient with this kind of thing but I would expect more content, instead over the years, the only thing I got was constant bug fixes, Sound for this game, and a prettier UI, as for the contents over the years the only thing I can pinpoint would be the harpoon which you can't even bring it around with you, you have to build the thing on a certain spot/area, a few wearable items and a new weapon type which to my knowledge you can easily copy and paste existing assets from things that already exist in this game and sort of change the values up a bit, Honestly a modder can do this in his free time, An overhaul for the character as well as a new race which I almost forgot it even existed because everything as it is right now seems to be a bit out of context and forgetable, and of course prison stuff and a few more dialogues, I mean what else did I forget? does it really matter at this point? thats not much for a game thats been in developement for years.Now of course, the review (I wouldn't call it a review) has to do with me recommending the game for you, that does not mean I hate the game, in fact, I actually enjoy it, but the developers need to step it up, be a little faster with progression, add more content to the game instead of just bugfixes, Give your modelers a job to do, get them to rig more heavy armor which is also something that lacks in the game, just keep adding misc stuff so people won't feel frusterated over the constant waiting, Anyways I truly hope I can change this review in the future, but as it stands right now, I don't think I can trust the idea of this game ever finishing, I could be wrong though and hopefully I am, And for the developers that reads this, Please make your mod community more accessible, some folks i've seen on the forums aren't even capable of rigging a custom armor properly without messing up the bones, that needs more clarification.

content:
Posted: April 3, 2015
Early Access Review
								Be a loner, part of a small team, make an army, make a village, or a town. Or an outpost for trading. Become farmers, miners, a lot of things. You make your story and its all non-linear. Perma-death for all characters. The only way to lose is all your characters die not just the main one you start with. Or team. You can start the game with multiple characters who you can all customize to your liking. And the customization options for this game are incredible. I mean really incredible! You can change the way your characters look at any time when you hire new ones and as long as you find a plastic surgeon in a tavern in villages or cities you find and go to for the older ones. Hire as many people as you want. Right now the current stable version you can only have 20 but the final release you can have insane amounts. Train, learn, capture people, take down people with samurai swords, die from wounds loose limbs, get eaten by cannibals. Save people, help others, lay waste to towns, become bandits. Really the choice is yours. The end game of what it may look like is close to the game series Zeno Clash. The Animals they are putting in the game resemble much of the animal life that is in those games and I love it! Currently the game is still buggy and needs more optimization but the current stable version is really good to play. If you want to try it you won't be displeased. This game is amazing!

content:
Posted: May 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								The game is very different from anything else I have played, it's a mix of a Squad RPG and a city builder.  The concepts of the game are really new and orginal, however the implementation leaves something to be desired.  The game is riddled with bugs (even though it is early access) to the point where it's pretty much impossbile to play for more than 30 minutes without experiencing a crash.  Building placement needs a fair amount of work, and character collision, pathing, stuck areas all caused me to have to reload the game to a previously saved state ever 10-20 minutes.  Overall, it's an incredible game, it's just not even close to being finished.

								One of the FEW greatest games i've played in AWHILE> Its mildly buggy but THATS okay. If you like RTS, Squad based tactics (up to 20 unless theirs more than that), and full scale research and development alongside building/raiding nearby enemies four resources in the beginning, this is your game. It is what you make of it.Their are PENALTIES with your actions though, attack a friendly you can ignite a war. Anyway a few tips.. if your like me and like automation make a "auto" town. Heres a link to help describe it more.. took me about 10 hours before i figured it out thanks to google search.'http://steamcommunity.com/app/233860/discussions/0/846959876015153093/I rate this game a 9/10 solely because it caters to my lazyness enabling me to do micro management if i want and expand outside of that, alongside going the extra mile and letting me command up to 20 people at the same given time (or micro managing them) whatever comes first.Check it out, it will be the best $20 you've ever spent EVER

content:
Posted: July 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								First and formost this is an alpha review. This game is not done by a long shot so I have had glitches and errors playing this game. Also there are several aspects that I hope will be added later to make this game better. So if you will just find fault in a game that is not done I would wait and buy when it is closer to completion.That being said I think this game is fun an different from a lot of other games out there. It does have a steep learning curve because it does not have an in game tutorial so you have to either look online or fiddle around in the game your self. This game is also not a fast pace game. It takes a long time to make your character powerful. I have seen youtube videos of people sending a solo character into a cannibal camp with about 30 or 40 cannicals and winning. I can only guess at how many hours that took them or what tricks they found to power build. starting off you cannot even fight one guy alone it seems. you will hug the cities and bring bandits to the city guards to fight and help them out. if you are willing to put in a bit of time this can be a very fun game.

								bought this game on the daily deal sale and i have to say i like it! it looks like it has alot of potential as im playing it in the alpha state there are a few bugs sure and the map is huge with not much way to travel and lots of sand. but watching your squad of people slug it out is sort of fun! the base building is pretty good as well i cant wait to see more option and things there and maybe some siege or attacks on the players. so for this review i would say 3/5 giving it room for improvement :)some pro's:the squad based fighting is cool!the base building feature is nice fun to place a mark in the worldthe fact the your units take damage to certain body parts and can bleed to death is interesting.the cons:the map is huge! even with the speed feature your running alot! <maybe add horses or camels to ride around?>there is alot of sand and not much changes to it! <maybe add some weather features? it rains in the desert sometimes>the slug fest does get bland but the game is early <i heard you may be adding some limb loss features that would be neat!>all in all the concept behind this game is great and i cant wait to see it progress :) GL!

content:
Posted: January 24, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is a very fun game to mimic a steam punk sword-play world with a feeling of being on the baren planet of Tatooine. Add in the Hutts, vibroblades, dewbacks and maybe a geriatric Jedi, and you have yourself Star Wars. The creators should add some similar music when entering cantinas as a joke. The game has a fatalistic feel where civilization is tattered. You will struggle to get a foot hold but attention to detail will help you a great deal. I love this game and it is only in alpha stage. Taking this into consideration, when finished, i feel this game could be one of the greats in terms of unique setting and customization options. It may have a lot to accomplish still, but if you think you may like it, you should get on board with supporting its creation. The more people that get involved, the better the game will be in the long run. Enjoy!

content:
Posted: January 15
Early Access Review
								荒廃した世界でサバイバルしていくゲーム。現在30人までキャラクター操作可能。キャラは酒場で3,000capから雇える。時々無料で仲間になってくれる人もいるのでお金がなくても安心。初期は街の人が倒してくれた犬の皮を剥いで売ったり、鉄を採掘して売ったりしてコツコツお金を貯める。仲間が増えてくるといよいよ拠点づくりを始めよう！拠点には城壁、門、家、井戸、石切り場、畑、鍛冶場等、色々な施設を作ることができる。また、キャラクターに仕事を割り振る事が出来、自動で働かせることも出来るので便利。採掘した鉄を精錬して武器を作ったり、皮をなめして防具を作ったりもできる。鍛冶スキルが低いうちは弱い武器しか作れないが、たくさん作ってスキルが上がれば状態の良い（強い）武器が作れるようになる。農場で牛と牛専用バックパック（大容量で便利！）を買えば交易もはかどる！技術ツリーを開放するのに必要なアイテムには「本」と「古代の本」等があり、より高度な技術開発に必要な「古代の本」はレアなので、遠くまで旅したり、古代遺跡をあさって手に入れる必要があるらしく、拠点作りが安定してからもやることがあっていい感じ。初期キャラ作りでの注意としては、種族「スケルトン」を選ぶと、一部の勢力からは見つけ次第攻撃されてしまう（その場合も人間を仲間にして人間だけで近付けば攻撃されないので、ロールプレイのためにスケルトンを選びたい人でも大丈夫。スケルトンは治療コストが高いので初期につらいという欠点もあるが……）。マップは十分広く、バリエーションに富んでいる（砂漠、平原、山岳地帯、古代遺跡群等）。しかも現在行くことのできる地域の数倍の広さの未開放地域があるので、将来的にはかなり広いものになるだろう。現状でもかなり面白いので、おすすめです！

content:
Posted: February 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is fun! Why not recommend it then, right? Well its because its not quite ready for general playing. After building a town you realize none of it really has a purpose yet. Thats fine, but it gets super boring. Economy isnt fully functional yet either, 10 minutes is enough time to abuse trade for a fortune, THEN build a city. Im too sad after playing it to explain anymore, dont forget this game, just dont buy it yet.EDIT- The time has come to re-review this game and it has made huge leaps into being what it claims- an open world sandbox squad based RPG. So many new options for building. Still have a rough a tumble problem, were just starting out you get rocked for a good while. Then suddenly youre the butt kicker. The base building is so much bigger now, after not playing for like 8 months. The game seems so much better. Its time to finally check it out!

								Holy♥♥♥♥♥♥this game is amazing, and has sooo much potential. Get your bases raided by bandit, slavers and all the above. or play with a single character (or group, or even get 2 characters and pretend one of them is you and your stupid brother) and go roam around only to get your asses handed to you and spend hours bleeding out unconcious until someone happens to walk by and give you a hand. Even as early as the first day it came out i enjoyed the few hours spent building up my bases, getting my people stronger, acquiring more people to add to my little clan, and also working hard (literally slaving away manufacturing items to sell) just to make a decent living for my group and get them the best gear i could.Though i've only played for a bit, every moment was enjoyable.If you guys like atmospheric, open world, RTS/RPG? (plays like a age of empires sorta thing) As well as a full on management on every single unit/character you got. THIS IS THE GAME FOR YOU!!!!

content:
Posted: August 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								The vast majority of PC games out there follow tried and true- but cliched and tired- rules that are based on making money.  For every interesting and original concept, there are 1000 copycats who bore the living bejesus out of me, copying Warcraft or Skyrim, or some other AAA lawyer approved crud. The beancounters control what gets made, which is sad.KENSHI is not like that. It's concepts are bold and daring, and the game is for the creative player who truly wants a sandbox without rules or carrots or narrow path pretending to be free choice.What makes KENSHI so interesting is it's complete freedom to choose whatever role you want, whatever cardinal direction you wish to explore, and it's emphasis on a more realistic combat/character. There is no being superman or a supreme hero in KENSHI. Expect to have your♥♥♥♥♥handed to you, and often, The game requires both patience and brains, which, frankly, is liable to hurt sales and frustrate the less gifted gamers out there who are accustomed to the likes of SKYRIM's mindless carrot following uber-viking nonsense. If you want to actually succeed in KENSHI, man, you GOTTA EARN IT.The game is tough and uncompromising, and the life of a swordsman is a brutal lesson in picking your fights, knowing when to run, and being smart enough to not succumb to greed and carry too much goods on you at once.You need to save your money, invest in comrades in arms, and constantly, slowly, train yourself to kick♥♥♥♥♥ That is what this game is all about, and it is almost umatchable in rewarding the player who works hard- you really feel like you earned the bad♥♥♥♥♥skills, once you acquire them. Whle the game is still unpolished in looks, the basic ideas are here, and I love this game.Things I would like to see added-1. Formations. It's too hard to keep your tough fighters out front and your workers behind you. I'm sure it's coming, but the need for good strategic preperation before a battle in marching orders needs to be a priority.2. More "home" decorations/furniture, etc. Home is as inportant as adventuring and exploring. Few games remember and acknowledge this. The more home feels like home in Kenshi,  the more real the characters we play will seem. 3. More variety in city shops. Currently most towns feel all about the same. Each town needs one focus that makes it seem unique, in my opinion.4. More combat variety to add some uniqueness to our characters styles- dual wielding, sneaking and backstabbing, missle weapons and maybe some shields and polearms would go a long way towards turning Kenshi into a good game with fantastic concepts into a fantastic game.But, really, KENSHI is the best new game I have played this year, mostly due to it's approach- it allows that true sandbox freedom so many other games asprie towards, but fail to achieve, and it keeps the difficulty bar set on high- making success all the more challenging and wonderful when you get there!I'd give this an 8 of 10, with 10 being well within range of achievement, with more polish and details.

content:

Early Access Review
								This is by far one of the best games I've ever played and I've made the circut a couple of times. Well worth the $20 and hard to believe it's still in development. The only down side that I've found thus far, which I'm sure will be addressed, is the lack of animals. I personaly would love to see this game advance to adopt additional climates and/or some sort of additional vegatation to be used in building, landscaping, w/e... I played the 'experimental mode' or whatever it's called and only encountered crashes in open desert. I honestly forgot I opted for the testing! This is some great work and a must for anyone looking to take their rpg/rts gaming to a whole new level of freedom of play.

content:
Posted: January 25
Early Access Review
								This is by far the best game I've spent money on in the last few years.  With all the options for playability, it allows for you to really get your hands dirty. If Linux support had been a thing I probably would have thousands of hours put into the game, even if it was just running it idlely and allowing my characters to do their own thing. I've wandered, I've built myself a city, I ran with a party and I ran by myself and no matter how I played it, I was always enjoying myself.It's very rare to find a game that has such an open field to putz around with, and even more rare that 1 person could come up with an idea for a game like this.  Yes, there have been people added over time, but we mustn't forget that this game started with one developer and was phenomenal even back then.I'm itching to get back into playing and once I do, my hope is that I can keep my real life going forward as well as the game life moving forward.  It's one of those games I could very easily sink my entire attention into and probably never look back -- thankfully, like any game the allure should wear thin... the problem is that this game has so many options to mess with that it'll probably take an eternity to find a reason to set it down and play something else... so my almost year long break from being able to play (one of the updates completely broke my ability to play on Linux) has been pleasant because I haven't been able to sink myself into the game for that time....however, that time is starting to grow short and it will not be long before my little army of ninjas/samurai take over my life once again.Thank you to the devs for making and continuing such an amazing piece of work.  Keep it up.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 31
Early Access Review
								This game is still constantly in development, so you might want to wait an awfully long time before there's a finished version. But, for what it is right now there's a lot to do as you manage a squad of people in a sandbox world becoming whatever you want. Whether you are a feared thief or the ruler of great town that produces only alcohol. At the start life is very hard with only a few towns as safe havens and lots of danger in the wild. It doesn't help that you're just a normal person that can't take on a group of many alone. That's the charm of the game, which is that you are not special in this unique world amongst all these NPCs in their factions.There's a neat damage system that goes off of limbs and other things like bleeding. You can improve your people's skills. You can be a merchant. You can build things. It's really fun if you like management and a sandbox. If you don't like having no direction, then you're better off not getting this game right now.

content:
Posted: September 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								Kenshi is a very interesting game.  Its very fun.  It has great RPG elements.  Survival-like mechanics.  You can build up an army.  Become a trader.  The game is a blast.  The game is not very face paced just to make that known.  Its about taking your time and making a real faction/nation.  When i first got the game i loved it.  But it was a very long time ago and it was in very early access, so it lacked in content and got boring.  But now with all of its updates and with the workshop, this game really feels like a game.  I rate it a 8/10.  It drops the two points because its still early access of course and its controls can be difficult at times.  But overall this is a great and fun game!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 26
Early Access Review
								I picked this game up a year ago and while there were a few annoying bugs(now fixed) it was an enjoyable game that was exactly as stated a free world squad based rpg... where you're not somehow special without working at it, and when trying to take on a bandit... they have friends.   I started playing again this year and the bugs had all been fixed.  The game had made actual progress unlike so many early access and it plays and feels like a complete game already.  This is the first early access game i've played where full price or more seems justified, rather than waiting for a sale.  The obvious interest and tangible updates by the developers is encouraging and I can't even imagine what else they will add to make it a finished product.  There is even the option for different difficulty levels by altering the world dynamics, and different optional starting squad compositions, anything from a small team with the materials to start a base, to the lone scavenger trying to survive the wasteland and find a few friends. (one note is that i'd recommend taking a look at some of the mods after the first few hours of experience to potentially reduce grind)

								BEWARE: Very AlphaBut this got promise to it, especially if you play the experimental verison and see what it can do. the damage system, instead of hps, it locational damage... this has the bonus of more satisfying realistic combat. *I find myself pausing alot just to see what happened to my fighters with every blow made.you start off as no body, and build up everything and everyone around you. it is one of those longer term games that you invest in, but I can say that, is totally worth it.***devs just need to be able to transfer our chars between each build of the alphas to make this a must buy***if you only have 15 minutes to game, stay away, but if you want an epic advanture narrated by yourself though a post apocolytic mad max + japan story<---this is important (I had a blast moving my initital group of people and myself across the wasteland to build their new home. each time someone gets injuried, an buddy have to carry him, slowing down the group.... do I carry on? or wait till he is healed. etc etc)this gives you everything. But yes, very alpha. ^dont buy if you don't want to deal with alphas, doesnt interest the you that wants to write a story.

content:
Posted: March 31
Early Access Review
								Had i wrote this review about 1 year ago when i played it for the first time on my friends computer i would of put the worst review ever. It seemed so unorganized at the time and i just felt like the game was just a mess. But i always thought about this game alot when i would scroll past it because i noticed later on that i really just.. didn't understand kenshi. I finally decided to buy it after i burned out on RUST and find out if i could grasp it. Let me tell you. When i grasped it. I didn't put it down. Kenshi is a Sandbox game that literally takes you into a world that no one cares if you live or die. There are many entities that will kill you and barely anyone to help you. Food is such a pain but i love the struggle to survive. Mining ore for a whole day (In game" to make ends meet to put food in my stomach. My skills go up from mining. I get faster... better at it.. i mine more and keep working until i'm making enough money to pay for 2 days worth... then i get building supplies... i make a shack... grind more and more and more. I finally hire a helper after and it changes the game dramaticly. Kenshi is not a game that you will just dive straight in and kill groups of enemies in your first fight. As a matter of fact your are supposed to lose. I won my first battle in kenshi on around day 70. I took my squad of barely trained lowlives and turned them into hardened masters of the sword. Its an amazing game. One that if you pick it up and actually try it and don't give up because you can't take the time to learn it will give you a lot of satisfaction when you finally make that small little farm town you always wanted.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is a game I've been following and playing for a VERY long time.  One of my first GL games, I loved the idea, the setting, and the core mechanics.  And while development seems to have been taking FOREVER (seriously, it's been in my library for over 2 years or so) it's actually been progressing very quickly, I'm just impatient.TL;DRVery realistic approach to an RPG game.  Nice open sandbox elements (done well so far), good combat elements that are in need of some slight refining but are otherwise well thoughtout and implemented, and the possibility to build your own bases/towns to form your own "faction" is great.Pros:+Everything?  Seriously, there are so many elements to this game it would be impossible to list them in the limit that Steam puts on reviews.+Music is good, not great, but immersive enough that it doesn't distract+Graphics are good, nothing AAA here, but the rest is so well done who the hell cares?+Gameplay: so without being able to go into too much detail because there's not enough room, they've done a great job with the entire concept of "play how you want" within the confines of the game and it's world.  Theivery, trading, combat, research and technology (which goes along with), base building, and the FIGHTING!!!!+Combat is good, since it's still in beta, I'm hoping they refine a few things that are buggy/problematic (Yes, stagger, I mean you, you annoying ♥♥♥♥♥!).Cons:-Still buggy, lots of crashing issues (still a beta so this is hardly a complaint, just a problem that in it's current state may detract from some people's enjoyment-UI is a little odd, in that it doesn't fit the game's aesthetics, but it's far from awful-Load times! But they're still working on optimising the game, so another item that will hopefully fall off the list (but needs to be stated for anyone currently looking at the title)-Some combat elements (staggering is a HUGE problem IMO), though this is purely an OPINION on the current balance they have for the game that I feel doesn't fit to wellIn-Depth:So I can't fit it all in here, there's so many good things to say about this game, but it's a great title.  They really took the whole sandbox combat RPG thing and just created something so spectacular.  You can almost literally do whatever you want.  Seriously.  The way things are done is super realistic (as much as you can in a game like this, anyways), from combat, to research and base building, to farming and trading, right down to the injuries people sustain and how it affects their movements!  You'll limp with a busted up leg, or cradle that beaten up arm, or hold your head so your brains don't fall out from that gaping hole you just got!  Ok, not THAT detailed, but you hold your head when it's injured!  That level of detail is downright impressive from even a AAA title!This team has done some really amazing work, and they deserve some major props, praise and a whole lot of cats... er, I mean cash!  I can't wait to see this game finished, polished, and then what they come up with next!
