Important bugs which make the game unplayable (path finding, stuck NPC, disordered structures (stuck npc During production) and still doesnt removed and doesnt fixed, these bugs were in alpha which started few years ago and still exist in the game. = ZERO PROGRESSION, JUST COSMETIC CHANGES AND STRONG WORDS BY DEVELOPER ABOUT FUTURE PROGRESS... Do not believe what the graphic looks on pictures and arts:I have GTX 970 and the graphic is really bad and ugly!! Nothing change. But go on oficial website you will se perfect graphic, but its lie!Dont believe to promises:They many times said: game crash fixed(UNTRUTH), memory leaks fixed(UNTRUTH), performance improvments(UNTRUTH), UPDATES COMING(UNTRUTH = NEW BUGS COMING).THE GAME IS AT THE SAME STAGE AS FOUR YEARS AGO << TOTALY EPIC TRUTH! NOTHING CHANGES just adding useless updates which never fixed bugs > THIS GAME IS UNPLAYABLE. QUOTATIONS FROM OTHERS OBJECTIVE REVIEWS: " I have only had it for the last year or so, and must say little work has been done in that time. Sure, a patch comes up every month or two, but only to add a new useless model, or a non working one. Something trivial that really adds too little to this beautiful broken sandbox. number of helpful: 4 of 16 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								Bort this game 2 years ago and I enjoyed it more then. It had bugs but it was enjoyable to play. I was able to survice long enough to start and maintain a health community that could survive a bandit attack. So after not playing for 2 years, I thought that would be enough time for the game to be finished. However in all that time the new features added are so broken that the game is unplayable (if fun is the goal). Lately gameplay is start new game, first town guard that sees me attacks me. Why? See a fight go to it to see if you can loot some dead body. What now it is stealing to loot a corpse it you didn't attack. In the early game looting corpses is the may occupation, however just standing near a fight will cause the guards to attack you. Why? my weapon is not drawn. This is all in the first town in the first 10 mins. Talk to someone town guard attacks you. Be a multi racial group town guards attack you. If you manage to get past the town guard and find a bandit, hopefully you don't starve to death first. Now bandit are rare thing to find. 2 years ago there was a bandit attack every 10 mins. Kill the bandit loot his corpse. Finally I have something to cover my naked chest. Go to town to sell loot. Town guard see me and kills me. I guess because I was wearing the bandits clothing I was a bandit. Makes no sense in any RPG game out there.There seem to be a complicated system for factions that is broken. As I said 2 years ago I thought that if they fixed the bugs and finished the crafting trees. All the game needed was some direction. There are no quest marker or any aid as where to go. There is not even a quest system. So if you get a quest go to the temple, that is it. No more info as to where this temple is. Needless to say I never found the temple. Even after running into every building in the town. A simple marker on the map and a icon above the build. How difficult would that be compared to trying to fix broken systems like slavery, factions etc. At this point that would be to much to ask for. I would be happy if I could play the game without getting attacked by the town guard for no apparent reason and at least know why in the starting town am I attacked on sight.This game had massive potential but I don't think the devs have the skills needed to manifest that potential. In 2 years the game is more broken than what it was. That is why I give this a thumbs down.

U click on a line and can change option. Very intuitive.6. By default it's not full screen and u can't scroll to full screen options in settings7. In windowed default mode main menu buttons just... drops somewhere to the right...8. There are no < or > texts on buttons on character selection...9. Apparently this was in development for around 2+ years (as of 2/3/2014)I just... what the hell did I pay for... as of February 3rd this game doesn't worth a single dollar.

content:
Posted: August 29, 2016
Early Access Review
								Please remember this is early access.Right now the game is poor at best. The optimization is really bad. I have a high end machine and the frame rate is just terrible even with the settings turned down.Gameplay is in my opinion the worst part of the game. Starting out, your weak, poor, and frankly, you cant do anything about it. If you read disscussions on starting tips, youll find everyone says to hang around cities and let guards kill bad guys and then loot the dead. This is great advice as you are completely unable to do any fighting yourself and survive. So the game from the begenning is based on you playing a weakling coward who scavenges the leavings of other fighters. This just doesnt sit good with me. I would rather grind or do fetch quests to raise skill enough to do my own fighting. I find it insulting that a developer would make the game this way. No reccomendation untill they actually make a game instead of a buzzard simulator.

number of helpful: 7 of 27 people (26%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game is probably the single worst entertainment purchase I have ever made and I saw Crossroads - the Britney Spears movie in theaters. I bought it during the early access craze based on it's potential 2 years ago. I bought Kerbal Space Program around the same time. KSP had its issues, but clearly had changes being made and steadily got better and has reached full release. Every so often I popped in this game and tried to play thinking it would be better in any way and it simply wasn't. I saw reviews stating essentially that you have to get 3-5 hours in before my complaints with the game are no longer valid (boring world, looks like garbage, clunky interface, shattered hopes and dreams) and while that may be true, it seems like Stockholm Syndrome to me. The fact that this game has been in "Alpha" since 2009 is just more proof that it shouldn't even be for sale.Do yourself a favor and don't buy this game until it gets a full release. Don't be fooled by people who put in a ton of time and tell you it is great as long as you get over X, Y, and Z- it is just justification for wasting their own time and money. This is an incomplete, likely never to be complete, dumpster fire of a game. Value yourself and your time more - don't buy this game. I expect that this "game" will be a fully playable and complete game for its value around the time of the heat death of the universe.

content:
Posted: January 19
Early Access Review
								I regret buying this game. This really burned me. I thought the concept was really amazing, I thought the graphics were decent for what we were looking at in terms of supposed game play. Let me tell you now why I would never recommend this game or ever suggest buying it.1. It is unplayable. Truly it is. It is so bad, incredibly glitchy, and it is insanely hard. There is no objective so you are left to wander about with nothing to do, you literally just try to survive. Which is damn near impossible. EVERY faction will hate you, and you cannot join a faction to gain allies.2. The build system is a joke. Like honestly I have nothing good to say about it. You will not survive long enough to dig far enough into. Once you reach a certain point a wandering group of 30ish bandits will just wander around your camp and kill everything. 3. There is no gameplay. There is no point like I said before, but needs to be said again. Like its just survive, which is cool in all, and it WOULD be fulfilling if it were not for the fact there is ZERO NPC or story interaction.In a nutshell I would desribe this game in the following way: basically it is a kid playing in a sand box, byhimself, with zero imagnination. You are alone, by yourself with nothing to do, you got two plastic army men and thats it. Oh and it is raining and squirlles are terrorizing you.

number of helpful: 4 of 24 people (17%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								The description of the game excited me. I found the execution of the game (at time of writing) did not meet with the excitement and expectation. The controls are very awkward. There is little indication in the game world of what you are supposed to do.When mining an iron resource, my character was actually severl in-game feet away from the rock. His pickaxe was actually digging into turf. After several minutes of mining the turf, there was nothing in my inventory.My character had a hunger attribute. None of my activities seemed reduce it (this may be an unfinished feature). My starting point was near some domestic beasts, but my character was not able to do anything with them.After running around the game world for about 20 minutes, trying different things, and getting lost, I refunded the game. That was a disappointment to me. Maybe as the game progresses in development I'll pick it up again.

								This game... Has the potentiel to be one of the best games of all time.  It is a lot of fun and hours will fly faster dollar bills at a strip club.  You will love Kenshi, but I wouldn't recommend getting in now in its current state.The only reason I say this is because it will torture you for waiting.You will play the game, and you will learn everything and thrive.  After awhile you'll realize that its all pointless.  It's all pointless because you will cap out early and everything willl go away whenever the next update comes out.  Because it's still in eary access.My problem is that you could create the greatest character, but it's pointless because it'll all be gone whenever the next update comes out.  Every update adds great rich content to the game; although, the game updates slower than dial-up.The game has been in developement for about three or so years I believe, and it will probably be at least another year before its completion.  I'm still technically recommending the game because I can't bring myself to actually not recommend it.  It truly is an amazing game that everyone should get.  If you've read this article hopefully you take this advice: wait till it officially releases to buy it, or if its on sale buy it and wait till its actual release or later builds.  It will save you many hours and heartache.

content:
Posted: May 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								I was kind of worried I might have bought the game and wasted 20 bucks on it, turns out to be really amazing once you get into it. It has its ups and downs, for example: some buildings are buggy, sometimes pathing isn't the best, some characters will stay stuck in a rock. But, since it is alpha state, I guess you can give it a little of a blind eye, the updates aren't as frequent, don't expect one every week or so. The game starts out slow, and is a really slow pace game, however, once you understand everything you will get so into it. For example: you will won't go into a bandit fight and hope to win, with just three characters with you, unless you plan how to distract some, and move around to flank. Maybe you want to be a loner, well, you start at the bottom and make your way to the top. Slowly, but surely, you will make it. Want to build the best town in the whole map? Go ahead, but prepare yourself for some random battles with the bandits. Want to be a merchant? Then you must travel the whole land to might the best prices to buy and then sell. The best thing about the game, is simply put, this is how you make your story. You aren't unique, just a regular guy. Good luck.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								Kenshi, even in its early stage, provides an enjoyable experience for anyone wishing to explore a post-apocalyptic world in the form of an RTS/RPG mixture.With mechanics similar to the Dungeon Siege games, this squad-based strategy game allows you to control a large group all at once, or sticking with one character if you desire a more solo experience. What is interesting about this game is that it resembles the early Fallout games in its adventuring elements, while also providing a fun atmosphere for building a town from scratch. You can either loot fallen enemies (or friendlies heh heh) and sell their gear to a merchant, or keep it for yourself if it is better than what you currently have. You can gather materials to build a settlement, or buy goods from one town to sell for a higher profit in another.The wasteland at this point in the development is comprised of roving groups of bandits, patrolling troops from the larger towns, and emptiness. The landscapes are desolate, a theme often attributed to the post-apocalyptic genre. The towns provide safe havens from bandits and cannibals, but those players who are more adventurous have the option to strike out on their own, find a suitable site, and build their own town. If you do create a town, beware, you will be attacked by bandits! Something that is both challenging and engaging about this game is the combat system. Much like games such as Mount&Blade, your characters improve with experience. The more they fight, the better fighters they will be. This adds a nice feeling of realism to the game that guarantees that your characters won't be "special" with ridiculous skills, and actually work to improve their abilities over time. The characters are also customizable, which is nice for those of us who are picky about appearances and cosmetics.However, there are still some drawbacks as it is still only in the alpha stage. Characters often glitch (I had a character glitch onto a wall that had no ramp, the only way I got him down was to command him to follow an npc who also somehow got up there), and the building parameters, while mostly freeform, can cause you a lot of frustration due to your characters being unable to reach certain locations. The game also crashes often, so you have to save consistently or you may lose your progress. What is nice is that the developers are often updating the game, so these problems will only improve with time while new elements are added to the game.Regardless, even with the occasional frustrations of the glitches, the gameplay is fun and the combined experience of the post-apocalyptic world with travelling, exploring, adventuring, trading, and building can easily draw you into an addicting (and satisfying) way to spend your time.

content:

Early Access Review
								There are so many good things I have to say about this game - so many in fact that I'm not going to bother listing them. All I'm going to say is that if you like strategy, customization, deep gameplay, end-of-world/survival scenarios, beautiful music, or just enjoy challenging games that don't hold your hand every step of the way, then kenshi is certainly a game for you. This game is so huge and has so much to it (with much more on the way) that it is a shining example of what every big game aspires to. The fact that it is still in developmentserves only to amaze me as I imagine what will come next. Even as I write this review the few complaints and issues I have for this game are being worked out and many of those have already been fixed. Updates are regular and comprehensive with the community enjoying contact with developmers in a way that only an indie can provide.In short this game is amazing with a huge amount of potential, and something I would definately recomend.Also the music is so good that I sometimes sit at the menu screen just to listen to hear it :D

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 21, 2013
Early Access Review
								Where to start off with Kenshi, I bought this near the start of it's development and I was wary and almost even regretting my purchase before I played it. As soon as I booted up the game I was confronted with a primitive menu so I decided to take the plunge and start a new game. The character creator was very limited and you could barely customise the base model at all and so I just decided to leave my character as default and get into the game. Oh boy, desert as far as the eye can see. I really was not enjoying my first half hour on Kenshi but I stuck to it and eventually when I got used to the gameplay and mechanics I was oddly enjoying myself. I didn't mind that there was no sound at the time, I didnt mind that it was nothing but desert, I didn't mind the skeleton menu and character creator. I was building my own village, smithing weapons and mining resources. Bandits would come once in a while only to be beaten by my assorted cohort of slave labourers all armed with massive two handed weapons. The combat in this game is satisfying, limbs can be disabled and you will need to have medkits handy when your peons are♥♥♥♥♥♥at fighting. There's a lot to be completed before Kenshi should be released, new biomes is what I want to see first. Music has been added and sounds great. Graphics have been improving over time and even the character creator is more fleshed out now. Overall, I'd reccomend Kenshi if you're willing to support an early access game, if not wait till it's released. It's flawed, but it's fun.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								"7/10. Ugly but cool. A possible 10/10 when it's finished." According to My Own Rating. The game is on EA, but make sure you check the update notes to see if you're confortable with the development speed. Also, ignore the store page's screenshots and videos. Look for real gameplay videos and screenshots instead.The trailers and the screenshots have nothing to do with the game I've been playing. Not sure if it's the ugliest cool game or the coolest disturbingly hideous looking game I've played. Either way, it will crash very often, your characters will be possessed by demons, The Exorcist style. Sometimes you'll find half buried npcs, other times you won't because they're completely buried. You'll find more disturbing glitches than you can count. And you'll still keep on playing. And will have fun.Really... the game looks nightmare terrible. But it's fun. The gameplay is very rich in details, allowing you to rise from the guy with a stick that hides until the battle is over and comes along to loot the corpses to the founder of your own city or a bandit leader. And you actually get to work your way into it however you like. You don't pick a merchant profession with a merchant quest.. you spend the coins you got to buy trade goods and run your way into another town to sell. Until you're rich enough to buy a backpack or hire more people to carry more stuff. You don't pick bounty hunter class... you roam around the world and find people with bounties, beat the crap out of them without killing, carry them while they're unconcious and deliver to the police. You don't pick a quest that leads you to rule a city.... you gather up people, grab construction materials, find a good spot and build your city there.TL;DR: Awesome game buried under hideous graphics. Very interesting and fun, but nightmare ugly. I usually don't mind about graphics and found it to be disturbing. To make it easier to understand the situation: http://cloud-2.steampowered.com/ugc/577897729358389123/559D45F6E77FF6B29A61B5C8700962CD628AD27B/If you can cope with demon possessed workers, impossible to click npcs, walls that only stop your characters etc, along with having to use the quicksave every few minutes to avoid wasting too much time, this game will be awesome.

								Amazing open world RPG or RTS, depending on your playstyle. Huge ammount of depth so far, and easy to lose yourself in. Imagine some sort of post-apocolyptic desert world filled with bandits and people trying to uphold some sort of law, and sprinkle this with some heavily inspired steampunk and oriental saumrai design. Interesting gaming mechanics all over the place with forging of clans, building of villages and starting a trading society.All in all, I strongly suggest you check it out. Atleast see some YouTube videos of it's gameplay. 9/10

								This game is awesome, it combines solid fun base building with RPG group gameplay in an open world environment. The graphics aren't stellar but that will change as it's developed. I can't wait for the future adventures this game holds! Currently your primary source of entertainment is traveling around, fighting, trading and base building. All of which are made rather difficult roving bands of bandits but after you learn the basics they are easy to hold off. The fun in this game for me is the combination of open world fun and the base building aspect. You build anywhere and just start creating your own little town with the help of (up to 19 or so - i think this can be increased with a mod) followers. If this game were to ever work with Mout & Blade I may never return to the real world. :)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 8, 2014
Early Access Review
								Kenshi is a very flexible open-world game, with a game engine which consist of neatly balanced mechanisms such as damage/death system, economy system, base building group commanding systems as well. As for now there is no victory condition like a story ending- you need to choose what do you want to achieve yourself. You can be a fighter, trader, bandit or even a commander of a whole bunch of your folks equipped with whatever you gave them, each one with his own abilities and skills. Every man in your party can be trained in a different way starting from a slave/worker to a thief or even a turret operator. I like this game, because of the number of posibillities of what you could be from the start of the game to the ending.However, in my honest opinion, I think that the game still lacks a few things that could make the game 4267356345 times better than now. Things like: rideable horses (<3), archery (planned in future), long weapon group, such as spears or sth and a finishing move to kill the bad guys that fell on the ground wounded (yep, you cannot finish him, unless he is to much shredded that he will bleed to death).In sum of all I can give it a 9/10 grade, because of the missing content I already mentioned :)Cheers,Woodman

content:
Posted: May 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								I was sitting in a tavern trying to push my wares freshly looted from the unconcious bandits that threw themselves on the trained samurai at the front of town when suddenly a half naked man runs into the shop.  The man doesn't seem to notice or care about the four heavily armed asailants chasing him.I paused the game and started to sweat a bit as I moved my cursor over the armed men to check if they were going to kill me next.  After a quick click it looks like they're friendly and only one person is dying here today.  I am relieved.  That's when the naked dude springs into action.Like a flash he jumps the counter, grabs a hat (pretty sweet one too), and then stands up to the four men as they chop him down mercilessly.  I tried to get a stab in myself just to show the armed men I was always on the right side.  I think I stabbed him in the gut.  Well enough of us stabbed him in the gut that he was truly going to die while lying on the floor of the shop.  The brave man sacrificed his life just to steal a hat from that merchant.  I did the only thing I could think of to honor that sacrifice.  I took that fresh new hat and his pants while he lay unconcious.  Money baby!10/10.

content:

Early Access Review
								This game... Has the potentiel to be one of the best games of all time.  It is a lot of fun and hours will fly faster dollar bills at a strip club.  You will love Kenshi, but I wouldn't recommend getting in now in its current state.The only reason I say this is because it will torture you for waiting.You will play the game, and you will learn everything and thrive.  After awhile you'll realize that its all pointless.  It's all pointless because you will cap out early and everything willl go away whenever the next update comes out.  Because it's still in eary access.My problem is that you could create the greatest character, but it's pointless because it'll all be gone whenever the next update comes out.  Every update adds great rich content to the game; although, the game updates slower than dial-up.The game has been in developement for about three or so years I believe, and it will probably be at least another year before its completion.  I'm still technically recommending the game because I can't bring myself to actually not recommend it.  It truly is an amazing game that everyone should get.  If you've read this article hopefully you take this advice: wait till it officially releases to buy it, or if its on sale buy it and wait till its actual release or later builds.  It will save you many hours and heartache.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								I was kind of worried I might have bought the game and wasted 20 bucks on it, turns out to be really amazing once you get into it. It has its ups and downs, for example: some buildings are buggy, sometimes pathing isn't the best, some characters will stay stuck in a rock. But, since it is alpha state, I guess you can give it a little of a blind eye, the updates aren't as frequent, don't expect one every week or so. The game starts out slow, and is a really slow pace game, however, once you understand everything you will get so into it. For example: you will won't go into a bandit fight and hope to win, with just three characters with you, unless you plan how to distract some, and move around to flank. Maybe you want to be a loner, well, you start at the bottom and make your way to the top. Slowly, but surely, you will make it. Want to build the best town in the whole map? Go ahead, but prepare yourself for some random battles with the bandits. Want to be a merchant? Then you must travel the whole land to might the best prices to buy and then sell. The best thing about the game, is simply put, this is how you make your story. You aren't unique, just a regular guy. Good luck.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								I may not have sunk that much time into this game, but i absolutely love it. This is the type of game i wish i could play more often. Realistic, no superpowers or anything that makes your character(s) better than the rest of the npcs. You all start out on equal territory and have to 'lvl' your skills from the ground up. (I say level because while your skills do have levels that directly effect you and your effectivness your character does not level up in the sense of going from being Level 1 to Level 2). The game pretty much starts you off with the shirt on your back and says good luck. However it does have different beginnings for you to choose from ranging from a simple wanderer to a wounded military man, hell even to a group of disgruntelled villagers setting out on their own! Simply put this game gives you not set story to follow, it lets you write your own.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								tl;dr This game isn't for everyone but if you love open world sand box games you can easily mod yourself and play anyway you want you should get a kick out of this game.Kenshi is an open world sandbox for you to create your own goals and achieve them any way you want. It can be played as a solo character (lone samurai) type, or you can control a whole suad and build a town, researching and gathering your resources along the way, or you can even play as a trader by hiring your own in-town characters to manage your local business management (This is my favourite as it allows for powerful growth and you can learn the trading trends).Unfortunately there is not a ton of optimization going on here. The way I play, I have my squad dispersed across the whole (GIANT) map and I have to jump between them regularily, although there is no loading screen, it takes a couple seconds each time, and when you are doing things like just checking prices or looting multiple towns at once, it can be a little annoying.The $20 price may seem like a lot for the performance you have to deal with but by no means should that scare you away from this. There is only one guy making this game so the progress isn't terribly fast but he has been working hard on better game performance and addressing the needs and wants of the community.

content:

								Okay when I first downloaded the kenshi it was something 0.40. Man it was ugly. BUT dont you dare to judge the cookie on its looks rather than taste. No Seriously. My first encounter with Kenshi was from tag "RPG" I was like uh okay why not give it a try. Graphic ugly but it hardly matters in rpg games its just an extra. I had a ton of fun with it bulding things, going to town to town trying to get supplies and recruits trainig even capturing cannibals as traning bags to be released in full power on one on one match to raise block skill. The game is in early access please keep it in mind when you're deciding to buy. It has lot of features starting as an retired capitan for example boosts your starting stats in fights but leaves your pockets empty and one faction seriously♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥off that they want you dead. Very good solution for starters are to loot weapons from bandits when they attacking the town OR you lure them but be warned you're not superhero you're just an human with barely any special traits at all. If you want to outrun bandits first learn how to scram really fast or they'll catch up and probably kill you. But exacly that it is about a struggle to survive to build first outpost to gather resources and money for them. Though theres no quest lines yet theres still plenty to do max up technology gather as much resources as you can and better equipment whenever its possible buy blueprints that dont comes cheap and most important harden your main character as well your team mates. And for god sake think. Dont fight with 2 hostile parties that already is fighting with each other. Wait a bit till battle end and finish them off looting as much as you can. You dont want to get caught in battle versus 3 other hostile to you squads. Trust me

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								Let me start saying this. This game has an amazing atmosphere and the steampunk desert samurai vibe is probably worth it's own HBO series. The first two or three hours of this game gave me a feeling I barely ever have had while playing a game. It felt like I was playing that game I wanted all my childhood, but simply nobody created.But that's exactly the problem with this game. It's unpolished to the point of looking antique. With all it's amazing potential and fun possibilities, it's infested with bugs of both graphic and gameplay nature. It's extremely fun to play, addictingly so, but you soon realize how the outer shell of this game is just that, an empty husk.That would be completely fine for an alpha in development for maybe half a year or so, but this game is simply not gonna be finished anytime soon (I give it 3 to 4 years, if I had to guess-.-  Atleast at the speed it's been going). I hope steam kicks out this game from their early release line so that the guy(/s) creating this beauty can join a bigger studio and use their clearly brilliant talent on some more realistic project. Final words:If you have a very strong masochistic tendency towards unique games. Buy this and get a psychiatric eval done, there's something really wrong with you.

								Wonderfull game, feels "real", i mean when i make a mistake,  i'm not willing to reload, i sufffer happilly the consequences, as the game allows mistakes even if it has a cost, and beeing hit hard by bandits can happen ! even if a character send searching leather is in coma, and 100miles away from my medic, i'd rather send him help before slavers take him, otherwise i'll have to practise lockpicking to get him back ..so i get ready to bodyguard my tiny medic woman , i leave heavy guards before my fortress, and go ! Feels real, lively, human sized, huge, very handy to have pple do what i need, :my steelbars crafter goes mining when the miners didnt provide enough ore (so do the smith when he lacks steelbars ), then goes back to the steelbars making machine, then if i want to build something nearby, he goes building it automagically (taking needed furmiture in the store , itself autofilled by other crafters)) before going back to his secondary work, beause his first is engineer, and he is in charge of building !of course, he wasnt so efficient in his early days here...I absolutely love the desert, the mountains, the cities...though they dont show nowadays netgen graphics, i love the characters, (the portrait panel auto updates when anything happens to them, clothing/armour change, coma, slavery...I love to have spent my day seaching the perfect spot , with water, ore, stone, and a wonderfull view on the sunset above the next town (handily close enough for me to send a character to said city in a clic, to buy/sell whatever i want there, when he'll be there, a window will pop up and i'll be watching him in a right clic on his portrait in the panel...only thing i personnaly disliked WAS the UI, looked too "fallout" for me (though i loved fallouts games), but i edited a few textures and now its ok !And all this is MODDABLE .i created myself a magical backpack with low chances to find it, found it and the, had the opportunity to pack all my stocks of resources to reload (import) my game in a brand new world as i had learnt so much i wanted to rebuild my home base completely, and destroying it would have been too time consuming.Bugs ?well i got a fair computer, maybe it helps, and now i know what can cause (the very few ) errors, (like loading a save after having played one without quitting the game..( never a good idea in most complex games) my save is 100 hours old, and i had really few errors, nothing gamebreaking or that couldnt be repared. So Kenshi is absolutely playable, if you've played any 4X, like samurais, strat games, and are not afraid to get involved in your teams life, buy and play, so the dev will "finish" his game faster, and make a second with plenty enough of money to give us the best game ever !hem, did i say it was moddable ?i forgot, spent too many hours aday these last weeks since i (finally) bought this game, and feel a bit tired.. but i must find that perfect spot for them, they are still waiting in the high city...there were too many bandits in the last one i had found...the dev team said:“Kenshi is currently in alpha state. The game is still in development and is missing many features."there is yet so much to do ! ofc, such a game can never be completed, one can always add features, new buildings, a new appearance for Ciry.. hem maybe not for Ciry..the point is that they have a roadmap, and want to achieve it before feeling the game can stop beeing in "early" access, but it IS accessible now, and absolutely playable.So get it, now !

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 25, 2015
Early Access Review
								One of my favorite Steam games so far.  The recent updates seem to have made starting a new game a bit more difficult, as instead of my character simply getting the crap beat out of him/her for the first few encounters and waiting for them to recover in a coma, they simply bleed to death.  I've also had recent issues constructing a base in newer games, no matter how far from an established town/outpost I choose to construct my base, it is still 'too close to a town'.  That said, this is one of the most enjoyable and challenging games in my library.  Character customization is extensive, and there are many weapon styles to pick from.  As of this review, the various factions don't influence much of the gameplay, aside from the bandit groups, the exception being the slavers.  After stumbling into their outpost looking for a place to offload some weapons my blacksmith had manufactured, my two characters were quickly incapacitated, healed, and dragged off to work in the mines deeper in the slaver compound.  As these were my two strongest fighters, I had to reload a previous save.  After 44 hours, I have a decent base and a means to generate income.  It also keeps most of the bandit hordes at bay and serves as a means to explore the rest of the game world.  Recruits in the outlying towns are providing replacement laborers for my more experienced fighters, and I am slowly building an expeditionary fighting force to attempt to conquer a town.  It's been an enjoyable experience, and the only complaint I have thus far is that there isn't a great deal of direction, which may be frustrating for more casual players.  Those who enjoy learning harsh lessons through trial and error will be richly rewarded.  I would recommend starting a game with more than one character in your party, otherwise be prepared to dodge bandit groups and shuffle between cities trading goods for profit until you can afford to buy the building materials you need to construct a base.  A larger party allows you to stand a chance in combat and salvage equipment from your fallen foes, which is a quicker way to earn the required cash and initially outfit yourself with better gear.  I look forward to the finished product.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								I'll leave this update up here. They have recently released a giant update which is really nice but more importantly it also solved a lot of the performance issues. So while the progress is still super slow, the giant patch they released is good and the performance is fixed so I'll leave my complaint filled review below still even if some of the problems are improved. Games still not perfect but its sloooooowly getting there.Super slow progress, and although its an amazing idea for a game and actually is pretty fun when it works. It's also a bug ridden mess that crashes a lot and will have game breaking bugs requiring restarts.I figured I would elaborate a bit on this as I really feel dissapointed and don't want to let it seem like I am just flaming the game itself. The game itself is pretty amazing in premise and at times kind of works. I have a group of people that I started with, and I go around recruiting more, they are weak as dirt and the game is challenging working them up the ladder of strength but the difficulty isnt a problem, I like the challenge. Skills and stats work in a way that the more you use them they will develop and become better, so use a sword, get better at using the sword type of thing. Many skills are available including movement speed, crafting, fighting, and stealth, all are of course raised through use. Now the game is a lot of fun if it would work, I get a set of about 15 people ready to go with 10 of them intending to fight. Still weak as dirt but with equipment I scavenge like a vulture from battlefields of other soldiers I decide to start fighting small groups of bandits to raise their skills and prepare for the future. Exciting stuff, scavenge battlefields for an hour or two and roam around to different taverns looking for people interested in joining for about 1-2 hours. Takes time, and its difficult to stay alive and uninjured, but its fun in its sandbox skill based system way.Here is where the problem comes in. In those 1-2 hours I've already had the game crash dozens of times, as well as had to manually restart the game as bugs pop up such as being unable to move my units or textures failing to load. In addition to this, with a PC that can run the Witcher 3 on max settings and other great high quality games on high settings, this game stutters horribly. I lower all my settings to as low as they can go besides view distance being just nearly the lowest in an attempt to not have the game constantly stutter. So the engine lags and crashes a lot, sounds rough but it can't be that game breaking if you save a lot right? Plus its early access so it's reasonable to think bugs would be here. Unfortunately this game has been in "early access" state for about 6 years now, of which I've owned it for about 5 on Desura and later here on steam. The game seemed like it had so much potential back then, and about 2 years ago I picked it up again played it a lot (even dealing with the mass crashes because the dream was alive that someday this would be capable of actually playing and enjoying). Now then this review rolls around, because I decided to see what progress they made and I came to conclude that they came to very little, and the game runs worse than I even remembered. After 6 years of alpha I can't recomend this game to anyone. With the progress being made I would say check the game out again in another 6 years and maybe it will be in a playable state, as the games concept itself is amazing however the playability of the game it self is completely unacceptable for a game people pay for .

I've also had recent issues constructing a base in newer games, no matter how far from an established town/outpost I choose to construct my base, it is still 'too close to a town'.  That said, this is one of the most enjoyable and challenging games in my library.  Character customization is extensive, and there are many weapon styles to pick from.  As of this review, the various factions don't influence much of the gameplay, aside from the bandit groups, the exception being the slavers.  After stumbling into their outpost looking for a place to offload some weapons my blacksmith had manufactured, my two characters were quickly incapacitated, healed, and dragged off to work in the mines deeper in the slaver compound.  As these were my two strongest fighters, I had to reload a previous save.  After 44 hours, I have a decent base and a means to generate income.  It also keeps most of the bandit hordes at bay and serves as a means to explore the rest of the game world.  Recruits in the outlying towns are providing replacement laborers for my more experienced fighters, and I am slowly building an expeditionary fighting force to attempt to conquer a town.  It's been an enjoyable experience, and the only complaint I have thus far is that there isn't a great deal of direction, which may be frustrating for more casual players.  Those who enjoy learning harsh lessons through trial and error will be richly rewarded.  I would recommend starting a game with more than one character in your party, otherwise be prepared to dodge bandit groups and shuffle between cities trading goods for profit until you can afford to buy the building materials you need to construct a base.  A larger party allows you to stand a chance in combat and salvage equipment from your fallen foes, which is a quicker way to earn the required cash and initially outfit yourself with better gear.  I look forward to the finished product.

content:
Posted: January 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								In my short amount of time with the game so far, I already have stories for days. This is a squad based, open world RPG snadbox. How many of those do you see? None. There are multiple starts to the game, ranging from waking up drunk, with a broken arm, and no gear, to starting with a party of 5. The game is pretty realistic, as in no magic or far fetched creatures. There are species native to the huge desert world that don't exist IRL, but these beings are so artistically crafted, it amazes me.The game is a sandbox RPG, which means it is extremely open ended. You can be a doctor, scientist, bandit, soldier, police officer, anything you want really. The game is perfect for those who like to roleplay as well.There are a few bugs here and there, and the occasional crash, so please save often.The devs are currently working on a whole new world map and multiple biomes, so updates may be few and far between for awhile, but it'll be worth it.If you want a RP heavy, open ended RPG, and don't mind a few bugs, Kenshi is your game.Kenshi is a solid 9/10 from me.Also, ♥♥♥♥ the sand ninjas

content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								I haven't bought many early access games, and luckily the ones I did buy are still being developed.Top of this list is still Kenshi, It's the one game where I'll opt for the (sometimes very unstable) unstable releases just to see some of the new content. I'm impatient to, and I'd like nothing more then to play the final game, but patience is a virtue. And the risk remains that the end result will be a game you don't really enjoy, but if you bought a couple games over the years it's no different then buying a full game you don't enjoy.Kenshi to me is the game that proves early access can be done right, even if the pace is slow. It doesn't try to please everyone, but it does it's own thing, and will most likely become a strong IP in years to come. I highly recommend this one as it will most likely become a classic.As for the game itself, check the Lofi games website or other resources before you buy the game. If I had to describe it, it's a bit like a real time fallout rpg with katanas where you can build your own town in the wastes.

content:
Posted: May 4, 2015
Early Access Review
								Having been with Kenshi since it's first apperance sometime in 2012, I've seen the game change.This is my first review of any game but for me Kenshi is a great game and with whats to come I'm excited so I wanted to give a piece of my mind on Kenshi, where it is now and what's to look out for in the future.Bear in mind I play using the experimental build, you'll have to activate this on steam in the "BETA" tab when in the games properties.Kenshi now.....As the game stands today you can build up and entire town, make walls and defences (crossbow & harpoon guns). You can farm wheat and hemp, make rum, bread, fabrics, steel, chainmail, armor plates, medkits, splint kits, a good selection of clothes and armor and a fair round of weapons.You can manage your men and women into squads and each of your characters that you control has his/her own stats that can be leveled up through doing all sorts of things. Doing combat improves combat skills and getting beaten and hurt in combat improves your characters defense skills making them tougher.Researching unlocks more stuff todo and there are some things you'd need to buy the blueprint first and then you'll be bale to research it and then build/craft it.There is much to do but as some others has mentioned, some of these features lack depth and content, true.But having been following the game since the developer Lo-Fi, was a 1 man studio to what it is now, I'm confident we'll be seeing more things to come.So what is lacking....The reputation system still needs some work, so far I've only been able to decrease my standing with the other NPC factions (bear in mind I might actually not know how to improve it) but simply keeping to fighting bandits and sand ninjas will keep your range of towns/cities you can visit wide open.Crafting can be fleshed out more and I've heard and read that there is more to come so I'm not too worried.The world gets quite small after you've played a good few days solid but again, I've heard a new world is on its way.Wildlife is a big challenge early on and even with a small group (I've been hunted down by a pack of 8 dogs once or twice) and generally I'd like to see some variety in NPC squad sizes.Pathfinding is quite a problem now but with the "CTRL+SHIFT+F12" command you can usually clear that up and remembering to quicksave also saves you from the "not too often anymore" crash that comes with using the command or just loading in zones if you're traveling a lot.End note....All in all kenshi has come a long way and it's had it's ups and downs, but it is currently very stable and lots of fun if you can remind your self that it is still in development so don't expect a polished fully working game and there is more to come.Learn to live with hiccups :)

content:
Posted: May 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								"7/10. Ugly but cool. A possible 10/10 when it's finished." According to My Own Rating. The game is on EA, but make sure you check the update notes to see if you're confortable with the development speed. Also, ignore the store page's screenshots and videos. Look for real gameplay videos and screenshots instead.The trailers and the screenshots have nothing to do with the game I've been playing. Not sure if it's the ugliest cool game or the coolest disturbingly hideous looking game I've played. Either way, it will crash very often, your characters will be possessed by demons, The Exorcist style. Sometimes you'll find half buried npcs, other times you won't because they're completely buried. You'll find more disturbing glitches than you can count. And you'll still keep on playing. And will have fun.Really... the game looks nightmare terrible. But it's fun. The gameplay is very rich in details, allowing you to rise from the guy with a stick that hides until the battle is over and comes along to loot the corpses to the founder of your own city or a bandit leader. And you actually get to work your way into it however you like. You don't pick a merchant profession with a merchant quest.. you spend the coins you got to buy trade goods and run your way into another town to sell. Until you're rich enough to buy a backpack or hire more people to carry more stuff. You don't pick bounty hunter class... you roam around the world and find people with bounties, beat the crap out of them without killing, carry them while they're unconcious and deliver to the police. You don't pick a quest that leads you to rule a city.... you gather up people, grab construction materials, find a good spot and build your city there.TL;DR: Awesome game buried under hideous graphics. Very interesting and fun, but nightmare ugly. I usually don't mind about graphics and found it to be disturbing. To make it easier to understand the situation: http://cloud-2.steampowered.com/ugc/577897729358389123/559D45F6E77FF6B29A61B5C8700962CD628AD27B/If you can cope with demon possessed workers, impossible to click npcs, walls that only stop your characters etc, along with having to use the quicksave every few minutes to avoid wasting too much time, this game will be awesome.

								I was sitting in a tavern trying to push my wares freshly looted from the unconcious bandits that threw themselves on the trained samurai at the front of town when suddenly a half naked man runs into the shop.  The man doesn't seem to notice or care about the four heavily armed asailants chasing him.I paused the game and started to sweat a bit as I moved my cursor over the armed men to check if they were going to kill me next.  After a quick click it looks like they're friendly and only one person is dying here today.  I am relieved.  That's when the naked dude springs into action.Like a flash he jumps the counter, grabs a hat (pretty sweet one too), and then stands up to the four men as they chop him down mercilessly.  I tried to get a stab in myself just to show the armed men I was always on the right side.  I think I stabbed him in the gut.  Well enough of us stabbed him in the gut that he was truly going to die while lying on the floor of the shop.  The brave man sacrificed his life just to steal a hat from that merchant.  I did the only thing I could think of to honor that sacrifice.  I took that fresh new hat and his pants while he lay unconcious.  Money baby!10/10.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 29, 2013
Early Access Review
								Awesome game, Really love it.Combines Group management, RPG factors and Strategy into an atmospheric world full of dynamic NPC's and plenty of open space to explore. Fitting and well constructed soundtrack adds to the atmosphere and the game itself isn't even complete yet.Have been playing the game on and off for about a year now and it's been great to see it developing into a standalone game, set high above most others.The AI is still buggy at times, but is seeing steady improvement with abilities to bribe and talk to raiders in order to stop them from attacking you.Starving bandits now go for your food and supplies which they then appear to sell which increases their factions funds (not seen them attempt to spend any of it yet though)Research and development has seen an overhaul recently too, with lots of new features such as blueprints and research costing money which creates motive for trade.Furthermore, lots of new buildings and crafting tables have been added, along with devensive structures such as large walls and mouted turrets to aid in defense.The skilltree is slowly being fleshed out with the new theivery skills which allow your squadmembers to pick locks and escape from capture, be it by the law or from bandits/cannibals.Lots of new armor, clothing and weapons types with multiple levels of research for each allows for a great customization of characters and you'll find yourself giving your squadmates nicknames as you slowly get more attached to the higher skilled ones.Overall a fantastic game and I really can't wait for further updates.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								Wow. Just bought this on sale. Should have read the most recent reviews about the development of it -- or lack thereof.So the game for me so far has been "Let's try to get past character creation without a crash.", five times now.3/10 - Stability issues. Can't even rate the game yet, and don't think I will be able to any time soon due to lack of interest in trying. Maybe if I throw it on an old square LCD I can get this to display and not crash, but as it stands this is probably the most crash prone game I've seen yet at resolution 1680x1050. At the price, it's not even worth troubleshooting. Moving on...Granted my specs are not the most current but: AMD Phenom II X4 3.4, 16GB Crucial 1666, Samsung 840 EVO 250GB, GTS 450 4049 -- runs anything from Saints Row 4 to Dragon Age: Inquisitor and in between without a hitch.EDIT: I dropped the settings to the bare minimum -- yes bare minimum including resolution. Able to get it to work. First impression, character creation rich, somewhat enjoyable. Entered the game, opened a chest -- nothing. Opened another chest, nothing. Opened another chest, nothing. Opened another chest, nothing. Apparently chests aren't for storage -- ok, I get it. Post apoc setting. Looked at a straw hat on top of a buried bit of sand, went to pick it up. Nope. That's an NPC and he's static, but he's placed in a buggy spot underneath the terrain. Looked around a bit. Wandered (as my option for starting suggested)...wandered some more, wandered some more. Absolutely NO life or interaction. Put down game. Wasted money. Moving on.Save your money. Or better yet get a Fallout, Wasteland or any other game than this one.Open world with empty content -- worst combination ever.

content:

								I have been following Kenshi for a long time now and have loved the game from it's first almost featureless and buggy Alpha release to it's current state. This is an ambitious project to create a game that should hopefully become a classic. This game will never have multiplayer. Nor should it. A coop mode would be great, however a large part of this game is the atmosphere from playing this single player.All of that aside even the Alpha version has a charm to it and I have spent hundreds of hours wandering around a silent desert with my little band, fighting bandits and training up my characters. I find the game very relaxing and peaceful. I am almost aprehensive about the updates. Even if Kenshi winds up dying a slow development hell death, the engine and the work that has already been done would be fascinating to build on. I will be keeping an eye on Kenshi for a long time to come yet. :)

content:
Posted: April 18, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is game actually quite fun, but it is balls hard at the start. Infact, a good 90% of you will most likely stop playing and forget the game ever existed because of it. I enjoy a game that doesn't hold my hand, but I think they devs went a little too far with it, because like I said, it's almost impossible to do much of anything at the start of the game and later on everything's a Cake-walk. Spawned in a small town 19 times and was ripped apart by sand-bandits every time. Bug? Perhaps, but none the less a huge turn-off. In case this review was implying it's impossible to do anything in this game, you can, but it's more a matter of luck than anything. (Bandits not spawning on your♥♥♥♥♥hole, or the local towns folk actually bothering to patch you up even though you saved the prick from a right thrashing moments ago..) In short, It's hard as all hell in the start and insanely simple later on. In it's current state it's fairly unbalanced, but i do see it being a great game later on. Before anyone says you can tone it down via mods, I am aware of this, But i feel it cheap that devs put so much stock in mods *Cough*Bethedsa *Cough* *Cough*Mojang*Cough*

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								tl;dr This game isn't for everyone but if you love open world sand box games you can easily mod yourself and play anyway you want you should get a kick out of this game.Kenshi is an open world sandbox for you to create your own goals and achieve them any way you want. It can be played as a solo character (lone samurai) type, or you can control a whole suad and build a town, researching and gathering your resources along the way, or you can even play as a trader by hiring your own in-town characters to manage your local business management (This is my favourite as it allows for powerful growth and you can learn the trading trends).Unfortunately there is not a ton of optimization going on here. The way I play, I have my squad dispersed across the whole (GIANT) map and I have to jump between them regularily, although there is no loading screen, it takes a couple seconds each time, and when you are doing things like just checking prices or looting multiple towns at once, it can be a little annoying.The $20 price may seem like a lot for the performance you have to deal with but by no means should that scare you away from this. There is only one guy making this game so the progress isn't terribly fast but he has been working hard on better game performance and addressing the needs and wants of the community.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 19, 2014
Early Access Review
A small note, my time spent on Steam is incorrect as I've spent most of my time playing off Steam and I originally started playing Kenshi with the release of 0.23.1.Quick and Easy    Kenshi is both easy and hard to define. What is it right now? A sandbox game set in an apocalyptic wasteland where technology is scarce and life might as well not be lived. It is filled with the quirks of an alpha, bugs galore, crashes, poor optimization, and unfinished content. Now don't take that the wrong way, as it is now, this game is definetly worth playing. It may take a while to understand what to do as the game forces you to make your own objectives, but once you do know what this game has to offer, you'll be spending countless hours fiddling around trying to build your own towns, trade, train troops, slaughter bandits, raze cities, declare war on the Holy Empire or even do a 1 man army playthrough as I am now. Oh, and Kenshi has the ability to be modded easily to fit your needs and provide custom content, so I expect some amazing stuff from you guys! One thing I do I have to mention though is starting out a new save is fairly slow and tedious You can avoid this by using a start that has boosted stats like "The Retired Captain."as you have to train your first few characters to reasonable stats, and I often find myself just letting it take care of the first 15 points in each stat by itself while I watch videos. Despite all the fun you can have now the real reason to buy Kenshi isn't what it already offers, but the depth and features it CAN offer. Like most of the Steam Early Access titles, it has an extensive list of features it would like to include some day. However unlike most of the other S.E.A. titles it is actually adding these features! You can find the roadmap on the lofigames webite. Kenshi is very much a niche game which can fufill alot of our wishes even with the limited content it has. An observation some of us Kenshi players have made is that even though Mount & Blade is very different, people that have enjoyed Mount & Blade often enjoy Kenshi. So hey, if you enjoyed M&B, you may want to grab the money in your wallet you had sitting there for pizza and just start tossing it at your monitor. If you have any questions or want me to elaborate on something or even give tips, feel free to add me and ask away.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 5, 2013
Early Access Review
								The game is still in alpha, but the amount of content being added is great. It recieves regular updates, and more than just simple bug fixes. Most updates include new features such as the recent addition to harpoon turrets to defend your base. Current version is 0.69.0. The game has music and sound now. Many improvements have been made to the stability of the game.My original statement of the game was that it had more than enough content to keep you busy for hours upon end. This is still true, even more so now. The combat system is great, for a squad based RTS. I really love the health and damage system. Still needs a little work, and he still needs to make the troops hold their weapons with a closed hand, but it works for now :pHaving an individual health bar for multiple body parts is interesting and brilliant. If the health for your guys arm goes too low, his arm becomes useless and just flops around. For the legs, he begins to limp heavily. Its fun to have a great big fight, then see the casualties stumbling onwards showing signs of their beating.Most importantly, this game does not hold your hand or treat you like a child. You will lose fights. You will be horribly beaten to a pulp. But you will get up, and fight harder. No magical being is going to swoop down and save you when you are moments from death. Only your allies or your own training can save your life.This game is now going for $19.99 ($17.99 if you get it during the current summer sale) and is worth every penny. I have no regrets about buying into this early access, as this developer actually earns our hard earned money by releasing high quality content. Try it out.

content:
Posted: June 4, 2014
Early Access Review
								There are so many good things I have to say about this game - so many in fact that I'm not going to bother listing them. All I'm going to say is that if you like strategy, customization, deep gameplay, end-of-world/survival scenarios, beautiful music, or just enjoy challenging games that don't hold your hand every step of the way, then kenshi is certainly a game for you. This game is so huge and has so much to it (with much more on the way) that it is a shining example of what every big game aspires to. The fact that it is still in developmentserves only to amaze me as I imagine what will come next. Even as I write this review the few complaints and issues I have for this game are being worked out and many of those have already been fixed. Updates are regular and comprehensive with the community enjoying contact with developmers in a way that only an indie can provide.In short this game is amazing with a huge amount of potential, and something I would definately recomend.Also the music is so good that I sometimes sit at the menu screen just to listen to hear it :D

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 27, 2013
Early Access Review
								Kenshi in a word is" Rare". Ive not had much interest in this odd themed games of post technology future esk genre but this one is by far the most enjoyable game that has been in my library. That is not to say there are not any faults with this game but rather then break the entire experience they only feel minor. I cannot recommend this enough to anyone since all the time things are being dicussed with the dev team which has grown and been very interactive with its community. Note though this game is difficult sometimes to understand and to be honest the pacing could be a bit off but that adds to the game rather then retract it. Enough of the fan writing, lets get down into a more focused view. What is Kenshi? to me it is a sandbox rpg with tactical aspectas finely blended in with management of a town you can build according to your own visions, this by far is the most fun but due to the (sometimes) brutal power of the enemy. The controls are solid if a bit complex in that you have to take time to learn which tab goes where but in most games that is a norm.The character creation is well endowed but not too overly difficult to use which can allow for some hilarious creations. Finally the combat, which is quite refreshing as you cant overly control your party or singular character and when ppl die, they stay dead which to me is a +. overall id say take this game for a spin if there is a demo and if you believe this is a game for you then id say go for it!P.S. there are creatures and not just the same human enemies, however the animals... They are terrifying :(

								This game is very fun and very in depth. But a word of warning :If you are trying to jump into this don't expect a full immersion immediatley. You really do have to earn it in this. You start off with the bare minimum depending on what class you choose and you evolve from there. You an literally build a town from scratch. And this is not Sim CIty. You have to mine for raw ore then process it and then you may use the resource ot construct your city. It's a very rewarding game. It is also very challenging at times with multiple different clans or what ever you wish to call them attcking you out of random. It's still iin development so give it a break. It does have its bugs and crashes. But I love it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 6, 2014
Early Access Review
								Day 1: I woke up in the middle of the desert with no memory of the fight before hand. I lay in a land of dead bodies and blood stained sand. I look to my left and see my best friend in bad condition, He needs medical attention soon or else he isnt going to pull through.Day 2: After one day of wandering the arid wasteland I spot a city in the distance, A rusty, metal beacon of hope in the distance. A surge of energy surges through me as I still drag my un-consious friend through the sand and into the city. As I reach the gates I find the town in havoc. Guards and civilians fighting off bandits and even a few sand ninja`s. I place my friend in a safe place and jump into the frey, hardly stoping to think about my deep wounds.Day 3: The battle was long and painful. I broke my arm and badly hurt my leg during the enormous fight that took place in the town`s bar. The sun was rising and as its rays kissed my bloodied skin I stood to look around the massacre that had taken place. My best friend still clinging onto life I left him in the hands of a inn-keeper who saw to his wounds. I noticed no-one decided to scavenge what was left of the bandits so I took my chance and made a decent amount of money selling the gear, Even lucky enough to find a sand ninja`s gear who was caught in the fight. Day 8: After a few days of baiting bandits into towns and watching them get slaughtered, I soon made a good amount of cats from the gear no-one ever seemed to take. I returned to the inn to check upon my friend to find him in fighting condition. On his feet and consious once more I embraced him as relief overtook my body. Using the cats I had earnt over the past week I geared my friend and I in military gear and set off on an adventure to avenge our lost brother`s on a journy that would be filled with loss, pain and bloodshed.Kenshi is truely a game where each decision you make can effect the world around you. Will you become a bounty hunter? A warlord? or even a thrill seaking farmer? Each decsion should always  be thought through and accesed based on how it can help you and your band of merry men. if you are looking for an modern RPG, give the game time. NPC interaction isnt a big thing yet, however if you are looking for a classic RPG where you simply go after power and wealth this is definatly up your alley.

content:
Posted: October 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								A squad surival and base building game set in a desert apocalypse.In other words a game you should be playing already.The big pros right now are a dynamic combat system centred around team work and modular base building. Essentially you can build any base you want (almost anywhere) you want it. It is also continously being improved and updates. Whilst slow the updates usually add significant amount of content.The cons are a rather shallow world with not allot happening in it. The combat gets boring. The base serves no real purpose. There is no goal. Even survival gets assured at some point so surviving the post-apocalypse stops being a problem after you build a self reliant impregnable settlement.There also some bugs but really the enjoyment of the game outweighs it and a few bumps are to be suspected in an WIP game. The game runs smoothly and is playable.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
Early Access Review
The most interesting RPG everI didnt know much about Kenshi untill it was recommended to my by steam. Browsing trough the trailers and steam store page i was immidietly hooked as it looked like "real time strategy" with build elements and multiple characters to play at once with its unique EXP and skill system that lets you make everyone custom to certain tasks (Soldier, Builder, Farmer...)The game also offers a wast open world that keeps getting bigger within the updates as the developer keeps on building more to it wich offers an interesting "Lets go on an adventure" kind of aspect.Good: RTS/RPG (The game is a mix of real time strategy and role playing game that gives it a really unique style) Freedom (Ability to be who you want or do what you will as well as letting you setup a camp where you want is so pleasing) Difficult (Kenshi feels quite hard at times wich makes you want to keep pushing that one extra mile to achieve something great like the new upgrades for your settlements)Bad: Graphics (Kenshi seems to suffer from its early access nature where the graphics havent been polished yet so they feel quite outdated or plain broken at times) Framerate (Sometimes the game keeps freezing for few seconds while doing long travels and time to time the framerate can drop to unplayable rates) Bugs (Several crashes have occured occasionally)Kenshi is a solid game even on its early access state and i can only recommend that anyone whos interested would give it a try as its a really unique experience that can only get better with future updates.

								Honestly one of the most unique games I've ever seen out there. Its not just a game you pick up and play, you learn so much and its extremely hard to be successful. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								I noticed that some people claimed the developer has abbandoned the project. What I'm going to tell you is that this shouldn't be of the least concern because as it is right now it's already worth the price, if you're willing to take a few bugs. I will not bore you with the implications of an early access title. You all should know it by now, I won't state the obvious, but what I experienced. I can only say that Kenshi's dev team handles things more responsible than a lot of those which went down the drain. Still, they are bound by resource constraints. So, now for the 'fun'(?) part.Does this game deserve your money and time? Short answer: Yes.Long answer (even though nobody will ever go through this):LEGGIT (or face inevitable death)!You are no one; Broke, with equipment that causes every starving bandit to burst into laughter. It is a steep path to 'King of the Desert' (subject to change once new biomes are added). You will run, you will be knocked unconscious, you will be wounded. The secret to success in Kenshi: What doesn't kill you makes you stronger (but what does kill you... well, kills you). But eventually, once you've looted gear off dead bandits you lured to some city guards, your own story begins. Recruit fellow guys and girls (and give them tremendously oversized... uhm, yeah, you get it) and build a squad of awesomeness that gradually becomes what most RPG heroes are in the first place: Da boss. Roam the desert and basically do whatever pops up in your mind. Turn up squad size to see how many bad guys your pawns (and your PC) can handle, build an economic powerhouse that produces top-notch booze (just kidding, weapons... but you can do that, too). At this point it becomes kind of a RPSG (Role-playing strategy game). If you like bori... uhm, peaceful stuff, you can trade, too, but damn, combat just makes more fun with the animations and very decently made combat system and AI. You don't control your mob directly but through tactical decisions.The path is long, but extremely rewarding (as illustrated by my playtime). Reaching the peak takes some times, but offers many milestones on the way. And the peak is being pushed out further with every update. It has been a while since the last update, but the next one that apparently is supposed to be released soon while feature some stuff that further polishes and expands the gameplay and world. Every update makes me cheer as much as new episode of my favourite series because they are significant. The possibility for modding also exists.Concluding, at the price of ~20$/€, it offers a magnificient bargain for the time it keeps you entertained. Still not convinced? Bummer, put it on your wishlist and grab it on sale like I did.

content:
Posted: October 21, 2013
Early Access Review
								Where to start off with Kenshi, I bought this near the start of it's development and I was wary and almost even regretting my purchase before I played it. As soon as I booted up the game I was confronted with a primitive menu so I decided to take the plunge and start a new game. The character creator was very limited and you could barely customise the base model at all and so I just decided to leave my character as default and get into the game. Oh boy, desert as far as the eye can see. I really was not enjoying my first half hour on Kenshi but I stuck to it and eventually when I got used to the gameplay and mechanics I was oddly enjoying myself. I didn't mind that there was no sound at the time, I didnt mind that it was nothing but desert, I didn't mind the skeleton menu and character creator. I was building my own village, smithing weapons and mining resources. Bandits would come once in a while only to be beaten by my assorted cohort of slave labourers all armed with massive two handed weapons. The combat in this game is satisfying, limbs can be disabled and you will need to have medkits handy when your peons are♥♥♥♥♥♥at fighting. There's a lot to be completed before Kenshi should be released, new biomes is what I want to see first. Music has been added and sounds great. Graphics have been improving over time and even the character creator is more fleshed out now. Overall, I'd reccomend Kenshi if you're willing to support an early access game, if not wait till it's released. It's flawed, but it's fun.

content:
Posted: March 12, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game. Just wow. As soon as i hopped in the game, i felt immersed in the world; Being thrown into a desolate, vast, empty desert, and with the old-west style music low in the background, makes me feel as though im really out wandering a dangerous wasteland alone.I started off with the default starting choice ( there are multiple choices: default guy at a town, group founding their own settlement, trader, etc). I found myself at Shark, and i was eager to head out in the world. The desert is a very dangerous place however, with dangers from roving bandit groups that will tear you apart if they see you. I spent my early days training on dummies and scavenging loot from the aftermath of battles between rival bandits and the occasional guard patrol. Pretty soon i gathered up a few companions and headed out into the unforgiving land.This game is seriously beautiful. But not in the way other games do it, but by the beautiful vast empiteness of the desert. Seeing how small and insignificant you are really adds to the feel. The landscape and building textures are great, the battles are friggin' awesome, and I cant wait until more updates come out.
