content:
Posted: August 5, 2014
Early Access Review
								To whom my review may concern (that even means you gamers, whom found pleasure in this game.) So lets cut the chase, so what did you think this game was gonna be? A RTS, A RPG? Why not a combination of both, and ya know what ladies, gents. It did pretty damn good for being beta, it has done well with the system it has set up, and you know what. I'm contempt with spending my twenty bucks. Now, lets boil this game down, like we can do salt to water. Let's start with...hmmm...I don't know. Graphics. I give them a 78%. A good, decent grade from where I come from. I'll go ahead, and state something right now. To all who complain that the graphics are buggy, or that it lags when trying to do the graphics. Congratulations, you now know what a BETA is. If you say the graphics suck, then you'd be wrong...very wrong. Graphics inside of gaming have been radically improved, and some old (Powerful) engines have begun to become free to the public. Needlessly saying, Kenshi is using a good grapic engine. A solid one at that. So when people I see complain about the grapics on this game, I see some fair points. The buildings have, on occusaion, had sand dunes in them. The cities would not come into the world, when you started a new game, when you got mad at your last one. So yeah, fair points, but Graphic code. By term of use, is very hard, and complicated. In fact, the simple desert world in Kenshi, is stunningly atmosphereic. I say, in all good faith, that this is just the beginning of a long list of improvements. Now, to the fair points, I would like diversity. Forests, plains, rivers, maybe oceans. I don't know, but I am content with a desert for now. Cause I understand that it takes a lot to make a game on your own, and develope it. Cause many forget, it takes BIG companies three years to even pump a next gen game. This guy is trying his best in the graphic department. So if he decides to hire on extra coders, then so be it. If he does not, then I hope he can improve the theme of the atmosphere. But, I would also like to note. That graphics don't make a game good. Let's talk about...GAME PLAY!Kenshi is a hybird, a rareity. Which is a masterpiece, or absoulte failure. There really is not a single in-between. In this catagory, Kenshi is actually very good. I give it a 89%. I love the functions, I love how (Sometimes) smooth your orders are carried. Hell the resource system, and how you not held to bounty hunting is a relieve. Though, lets be honest, the big money is in big game hunting (tis a fail joke, no?) I love it, I love it, don't backtrack. Just keep moving forward on this catagory. I would only make one suggestion...If it's in anyway possible, try to employ a class system. Though not a locked one, like when you create your character. Do you want him to have a better strength in weapon use, or do you want him to build like an adept. Gives him more survivablity in the harsh world. Now, with that said, I'd love moble archer units. Like a class unit, it'd be nice. But, I can only get, what they can make. So I am contempt. Now, moving forward, how about we...spice things up a bit. NPC, NPC developement, VARIETY and AI action. Kenshi, for all insentive, is very scarce in the form of animal life. But, it's set in a desert, so it fits the theme (until you make a forest, I am impressed) However, that being said, the opposite is for human life. Mainly, those who'd like to chope your head off. Or, seek shelter from the hostile waste, maybe looking for...a bite...with you. Needless to say, I don't give a immidiate grade, because I am going to explain it, very detailed. (Warning total nerd alert ahoy, ye wish to keep a sense of normality, please skip!) NPC, I love the illusion of variety, and amount. The illusion is the names of some of them. Like Samurai lords, to Paladins. They function the same, and you know what, they should. They're elite warriros, and they should act the same accordingly. Though I want to point out something. There is a problem with that statement, in that problem, can cause...a death of a good game. VARIETY! That's right, VARIETY. I want to say, that it has it, because you can create new followers from an existing models. I respect that simple, and easy appoarch. Because, it gets the job done. It gives a sense of immersion. But, with that said, the NPC should have a lot more dialouge. I mean, it's all okay right now, since it's in BETA. But, if the game should ever hit full fledge release, and hit the same issues. I am going to be mildly disappointed.I know your team works hard, but I might suggest focusing on character development for NPC. Like have a relationship system, where if you save someone with a character, they get a status as a friend. Perhaps as lovers, I don't know. Then they'd get a bonus for being near them in combat. Similar to star ocean series. Which is a good game series.So why would I bunch this all up? Because, they're interwoven. That also reminds me, why not impliment child NPC's? It would add a unique element to the gameplay, where the player may feel a need to keep some people more safe than others. Have the feeling of making the hard choices, that come with the desert living?Also, on the creation tab for your character creation module. I noticed a blacked out selection for HUMAN, and I wonder. Are you planning to add more to this world, than just human characters? (if so, I love this game enough, but jesus...I may be addicted) Also, let's talk AI. They are, and I repeat, they are running good. Why? Says the seventh game, just right before this review, I got beaten bad. They are competent, they are mean killing machines. They also do what they are made to do, and CIVILIANS will run. So that's good to see. (not everyone will fight.) So, lets go through the list (I got one more to go, but lets get a recount, and count. Graphics-78%^ (note this could change in later updates) Gameplay-89%VARIETY-68%^(note this could change in later reviews, and updates)NPC-77% Story (note I can't talk about it, because it lacks one, only evidence of factions. So I'll rate through lore)-74%RTS component-88%RPG component-73%AI (screw the freaking dust bandits!)-84%So lets talk about more of the future, and I got one thing to say...it's lookin good!Average rating: 78.875 (or...) 79%A solid C rank (Naruto...fan...shut...up...ya know.) WARNING WARNING, this is only BETA grade, flame shield is one, repeat flame shield is on!

content:
Posted: July 26, 2013
Early Access Review
								Definitely a sweet freeflow RPG game, believe it was one of the first games (or at least first 3) to get greenlit, although I had purchased the game before that. Lately the dev has been overhauling the game, finally implementing long promised things and getting near to completion. The game is extremely fun, with very meaty updates improving the game constantly. Definitely one of the best indie games i have ever played. The game basically has freeform gameplay, there is no story, it basically currently consists of factions and you create your own story and gameplay. you can be a psycho bandit, a cowardly merchant, a warlord for your favorite faction. Its extremely addicting and has become far better the last month, with new realistic 3D models, with brand new textures for items and upcoming audio and massive terrain updates, the game will be amazing. Definitely check it out, lofigames.com, along with surviving the apocalypse in  Project Zomboid, at  projectzomboid.com. Both with increasing prices as they near completion currently as it stands  - 9/10 overallEDIT: The dev is really hauling♥♥♥♥♥last year or so to finish the game. I didn't realize how outdated my review was. There is audio in the game consisting of a soundtrack and sound effects (has been for awhile), theres a wide variety wildlife, a new map (Although only about half or so is implemented as of right now, it is still amazing. There's trees, grass, mountains, rocks, water... the old map was a sandy desert in africa with like 1 broken tree every 600 miles) tons and tons and tons of new features (thievery, prisoners, the AI management in construction, researching, start scenarios, medical system overhaul, major graphical updates, an entirely redone UI, a tutorial window with text and images, new players models and character customization (there is like 5 races now, it used ot be Tribal or Human and they were identical, now its Human, a weird buglike alien, a "skeleton" which is actually like a ghetto C3PO droid, and one or two others). The game is still amazing and it's nice to see it nearing completion. I honestly never thought this would outpace Project Zomboid, as this was primarily developed by one crazy awesome guy with outsourcing until about the last year. The only thing, which in my opinion doesn't matter as the story is told through your gameplay, like Rimworld, is there is no story and I don't think there ever will be. You story is your starting scenario, are you a disgruntled War Veteran wandering the wastes for work? Religious pioneers looking to build their own city, A dirty thief that stole a powerful Holy sword from a body in a battle? It affects your startign relations, gear, and funds and allows you to roleplay the game, or jsut start with what you want. The whole point is it is highly interactive and realistic. You can do WHAT you want. Be a bandit, setup a thriving trade city producing fantastic weapons and armor, or sell crops and luxuries. Start your own faction and go to war. Live as a hermit. The AI react to you so through a reputation and morale system. If you execute a band of Holy empire soldiers you will receive a bounty and they will know you and attack you. Your base might be raided by bandits. Or a town might be raided and you can choose to save it, or join in the looting. You really can do so much and I feel like this is a vastly underappreciated entrance to the RPG genre. EDIT2: Lately the developer has also posted an announcement that features are being cut from the game that were initially promised, and while he plans to implement most eventually (maybe), I think that is kind of unfortunate for a game thats been in an alpha/beta development for like 7 years. The biggest ones that were a selling point that initially the developer seemed VERY keen on implementing were robotic limbs and being able to replace them with prosthetics or even high quality robotics. I do feel the game is more than worth getting, but it is unfortunate that the developer is now stating the audience potentially misread many of his long standing commits, such as a dynamic campaign. Developer states it is dynamic basically because some things are random, like you choose to attack the bandits, or build the town, the game no longer reacts to the depth that was hoped for initially, such as impressions, memory, revenge. Kind of a crappy explanation, but basically his definition of dynamic does not match mine. When I think dynamic, i think Arma 3 like DUWS, a randomly generated campaign with random missions/order and random placement, lots of random/procedural generation. Hopefully these get in the game post release in a timely manner, as this has been a game that I've used as a demonstration on how to do Early Access, even if a little slow, and it would be a shame to have things cut out.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								Please do not be turned off by the iffy trailers and wierd looking animations/graphics! This is one of the most immersive, engrossing & deep games I have played since the good old days when sanbox MMOs (SWG, EvE online) were still in vogue. If you like any of those games or if you like freeform sandbox RPGs like Mount & Blade, Elder Scrolls, Dwarf Fortress etc., then this is an absolute must buy. The freedom Kenshi grants you is unrivaled; you can play as anything from a slave to a merchant to leader of a ruthless bandit clan. It features deep settlement building mechanics, complex combat systems, classic stat-based character building, emergent story-telling where no two playthroughs will be the same & it has some light survival elements. What more could you possibly want from a game? The setting is super weird and compelling too. Kinda reminds me of Morrowind with the general alien-ness of the fauna/flora and the palpable cultural differences between each faction.,This is probably the most underrated title on steam; incredibly ambitious and it's already come such a long way for an early access title. BUY BUY BUY.

								Ok so this is my first game review on Steam so I wanted to make sure that I had enough time into a game before reviewing it.  After 130+ hours in this game I can honestly say that I can't wait for more. This game has everything that I was looking for.  It's a sandbox, base building, crafting, combat, trading game all rollled into one.  You start at the bottom and if you don't do something about it you'll stay there.  You must get into combat where the odds are not in your favor, you must explore, you must do a lot of stuff but above all, you must try this game.

Early Access Review
								For my first game review on Steam, I'll Keep this fairly short.This game has amazing features, and though it's early access, with a lot of bugs, There is nearly endless replay value. The way this game is played won't be for everyone, which is fine. Although, if you're a fan of squad based survival RPG's, this game is one of a kind.Be warned, this game can be very unforgiving. I'd bet there's a good 80% chance you'll die, so be prepared to experience many different means of "RETREAT!".This is an Amazing game, Dev's. Thank you to all who support this game as well.11/10 - Would get murdered by endless Sand Ninja again.

content:
Posted: March 1, 2016
Early Access Review
								Kenshi has a lot of potential but Is still in development, that said it's already very good for a work in progress.It takes time to build something up in this game (which can be good but is sometimes a little bit boring) and the enemys are pretty tought at the begining (I recomend gettting a katana to make the Character faster in combat and don't be ashamed to run away from danger (I ran A LOT!!) and avoid heavy armour at the begining It only makes you slow.AND FOR THE LOVE OF THE VARIOUS GODS, DO NOT PUT ON A METAL HELMET!!A good startegy is to lure enemy hordes to a town, have the guards kill them (hurray for Guards), loot the dead enemys,sell their stuff, buy good equipment and hire allys (you'll have to train them) the bigger your group the more enemys you can take on.But avoid canibals they come in VERY large munbers.All in all kenshi is very unique rpg/strategy/buildup/Simulator(kinda)/managment/indie-game.And aside from some rages against trolling canibals, I Really like the game.

								This game is really fun, lots to do and is actually a challenge. Takes time to build things and get anywhere but its fun, the small bits of progression is rewarding. Haha it was more like a really exspensive rental that Ill never be able to play again. If you have everything you need to play it Im sure its still good. However its kinda lame that the spec for the game changed after I payed for it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								Role play to your hearts content in this sandbox. Beta hit not long ago and man its great. There are quite a few ways you can choose to play from base building to theivery. Make a 30 man squad or go solo or anywhere in between. Factions bring the world to life and make your choices of race and even gender count. Craft gear, weapons, food, medical items, building materials... prison cells... kidnap the inquisitor and use him for a target dummy.. or a way to train your assination skills.The game can be pretty unforgiving at times but once you learn the ropes.. or at least some then its pretty darn fun. Its currently having features and the rest of the map worked on but theres plenty of a game to have fun with. Its been in development for quite a long time but the team is small and was just one man to begin with. But its sort of the guys dream and all the hard work of the team and this guy has really shown in the game. Specially since the beta hit. 20$ is a pretty good price for the game as it is now... and its gonna just get bigger so i would grab it and watch it grow if i were you.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								Ever just want to build a small settlement somewhere and fend off attackers?Ever just want to travel town to town through dangerous wastelands?Ever want to be like Ichigo from Bleach that just gets stronger the more times he got his♥♥♥♥♥kicked?Ever want to take those kick♥♥♥♥♥units or characters and import them to a "fresh game"?If you answered yes to any of those questions you might want to look more into Kenshi.Warning - When it comes to tech research and production it can take hours to get to where you want to be. So if you are impatient, easily bored, or prefer instant gratification then this probably aint the game for you.---------------------Kenshi is a squad based sandbox game that allows you to build, craft, personalize umits, and modify the game. All units skill up by doing when raising their skills. Which means the more you do something the better you get at doing it. This can reduce production time or increase the quality of the item being produced.You can build almost anywhere in the game. If you can walk there you can build there (provided it is not within the no build areas of existing towns.) Keep in mind just because you can build at a location does not mean your neighbors approve (including wildlife.) If you are too afraid of frontier settling then you can always rent building sin town and build what you want indoors.Be advised - Units were beaten, killed, maimed, eaten, starved to death, and abandoned during the alpha and beta testing of this game.

								I have played Kenshi off and on a LOT and I must say that the game truly is amazing, but there a lot of things that can still be done to make Kenshi snag you EVEN harder. Sometimes my people glitch under the ground, troops walk inside eachother. I LOVE Kenshi, I love the idea behind Kenshi and I love the progress they have made, but I want a nice smooth gameplay and it seems that the game is always updated with new content, but it's always glitchy. Guys, I give you a 4/5, but I see potential to be a 6/5. Please take my word for it you beautiful game-making team.

content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								Kenshi is totally fantastic. An RTS/RPG/Survival hybrid that's absurdly ambitious, but is consistantly marching towards its goals. Buy it now or buy it when it releases a full release version, it's up to you. It's definitely worth sinking a few dozen hours into either way.

number of helpful: No ratings yet1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								While still in development, Kenshi shows a ton of promise for those that are interested in games with emergent storytelling. Establishing a small trading-post among a vein of iron ore deep in uncivilized territory, my band of 5 quickly grew into a bustling town. They fought off groups of bandits and feral creatures as they established themselves as a fairly affluent frontier colony, using the ore to both forge weapons to defend themselves and to trade for valuable resources with travelers and nearby towns.Then, one day, the bandits organized themselves into nothing short of a war-band. The only one to survive was one of my runners, off on a trading expidition when the town fell. This lone trader wasn't some helpless pack-mule, however, having started as a bodyguard in the original group that founded the now-fallen outpost. She set out to find a new life for herself, far away from bandits and outcasts.She was killed by a beak-thing the next day.

content:
Posted: October 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								I decided to buy this game when it was on sale a few days ago... and to my surprise the game is actually pretty good they're many things to do in the video game games you can raid cities or join groups of people or you could just be a farmer. So far i still have no diea if the game even has a goal to it. My main issue with the game are the damn LOADING times like EVERY single time when you click a character from a certain area it laods and it gets kinda irrritating after a while. They should fix this. Also the tutorials are not good they don't really tell you that much about the game but the very basics. And after that they just throw you into the ame like you should know what you're suppose to do. At first it's extremely hard but if you give it some time you will find out that everything is pretty simple and not that hard. I enjoy the game and hope to see if improve over time. but like i said LOADING issues gotta go. Then i'll be happy with this game.

								simply, this game is a pure fun if you like chalanges and swords, martial arts fights. this is not a final version, so game need to be polished and optimized. 90% of ppl playing this game have graphic setup as minimal. but this game is something more than graphic. pure gem. you start as no-one, you can be beaten, killed, you can be slaved, or be eaten by cannibals... but also you can be someone who beats other, fight for his rights, gather team, settle and defend his new home, you can be conqueror or loser. you can be everything. thats what kenshi is. start is hard but with every hour you learn laws of kenshi, and you learn how to survive and at the end, it pays off.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 6, 2016
Early Access Review
								Poorly OptimizedBuggy at timesPathfinding is sometimes hilariousGraphics are horrendousSo why did I enjoy it so much? Starting characters are laughably so weak they'd die from cattle attacking them. You're not the hero, just another character just trying to get by. The world is harsh and humbling. However the character buildup and being able to assemble your own group and then eventually a settlement of your own was very compelling.Mechanics is simply enough just like everyone other RPG with some town building to it but the punishing gameplay drew me in. Treading lightly and realizing your characters are vulnerable wanderers and not conquering heroes like most games maeks you appreciate every single resource you can scrounge up. Then eventually seeing your characters being able to handle their own in a melee really makes it more satisfying to watch.Charming game with an interesting gameplay bogged down by performance issues.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game is absolutely astonishing. The gameplay available so far is amazing for its current in game state, Despite the bugs and crashes, Thanks to the quick developer responses to problems found in the game.Pro's: Amazing developer feedbackGood ammount of content for the current stage of gameHuge expansions taking place as of currentGood building system, Allbeit a little slow.Good race system, Allbeit a little low in aesthetic options for the newer races.Con's:A crap load of bugs. (Though, They tend to be fixed nearly as soon as they are reported.)MAJOR CPU/RAM hog.Slow paced. (Debateable as to weither or not this would be considered a con.)Somewhat frequent crashes. (As stated, These tend to be caused by bugs that are frequently fixed.)Lower-end graphics. (That being said, It's needed for such a large scale game.)All in all, I'd rate this game a near 8.5/10. While its still in alpha, There are content updates nearly every week from what i've seen, LEading me to beleive that the game itself is well worth the investment to help with the developer's, Er, Development.
